            "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,55 @@\n+/*\n+ * Copyright (C) 2016 The Android Open Source Project\n+ *\n+ * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the \"License\");\n+ * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.\n+ * You may obtain a copy of the License at\n+ *\n+ *      http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0\n+ *\n+ * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software\n+ * distributed under the License is distributed on an \"AS IS\" BASIS,\n+ * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.\n+ * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and\n+ * limitations under the License.\n+ */\n+\n+package android.perftests.utils;\n+\n+import android.content.Context;\n+import android.graphics.Bitmap;\n+import android.util.Log;\n+\n+import java.io.File;\n+import java.io.FileOutputStream;\n+import java.io.IOException;\n+\n+public class BitmapUtils {\n+    private static final String TAG = \"BitmapUtils\";\n+\n+    public static void saveBitmapIntoPNG(Context context, Bitmap bitmap, int resId) {\n+        // Save the image to the disk.\n+        FileOutputStream out = null;\n+        try {\n+            String originalFilePath = context.getResources().getString(resId);\n+            File originalFile = new File(originalFilePath);\n+            String fileFullName = originalFile.getName();\n+            String fileTitle = fileFullName.substring(0, fileFullName.lastIndexOf(\".\"));\n+\n+            File externalFilesDir = context.getExternalFilesDir(null);\n+            File outputFile = new File(externalFilesDir, fileTitle + \"_generated.png\");\n+            if (!outputFile.exists()) {\n+                outputFile.createNewFile();\n+            }\n+\n+            out = new FileOutputStream(outputFile, false);\n+            bitmap.compress(Bitmap.CompressFormat.PNG, 100, out);\n+            if (out != null) {\n+                out.close();\n+            }\n+            Log.v(TAG, \"Write test No.\" + outputFile.getAbsolutePath() + \" to file successfully.\");\n+        } catch (Exception e) {\n+            e.printStackTrace();\n+        }\n+    }\n+}"

            "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/android/platform_frameworks_base/contents/apct-tests/perftests/utils/src/android/perftests/utils/LayoutUtils.java?ref=899eecd41a6bf506766dfa64f9f17173add74cbc",
            "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,58 @@\n+/*\n+ * Copyright (C) 2016 The Android Open Source Project\n+ *\n+ * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the \"License\");\n+ * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.\n+ * You may obtain a copy of the License at\n+ *\n+ *      http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0\n+ *\n+ * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software\n+ * distributed under the License is distributed on an \"AS IS\" BASIS,\n+ * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.\n+ * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and\n+ * limitations under the License.\n+ */\n+\n+package android.perftests.utils;\n+\n+import android.view.View;\n+import android.view.ViewGroup;\n+\n+import java.util.ArrayList;\n+import java.util.List;\n+\n+public class LayoutUtils {\n+\n+    private static void recursivelyGather(ViewGroup currentNode, List<View> nodeList) {\n+        nodeList.add(currentNode);\n+        int count = currentNode.getChildCount();\n+        for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {\n+            View view = currentNode.getChildAt(i);\n+            if (view instanceof ViewGroup) {\n+                recursivelyGather((ViewGroup) view, nodeList);\n+            } else {\n+                nodeList.add(view);\n+            }\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+    /**\n+     * Flattern the whole view tree into a list of View.\n+     */\n+    public static List<View> gatherViewTree(ViewGroup root) {\n+        List<View> result = new ArrayList<View>();\n+        recursivelyGather(root, result);\n+        return result;\n+    }\n+\n+    /**\n+     * For every node in the list, call requestLayout.\n+     */\n+    public static void requestLayoutForAllNodes(List<View> nodeList) {\n+        int count = nodeList.size();\n+        for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {\n+            nodeList.get(i).requestLayout();\n+        }\n+    }\n+}"

            "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,94 @@\n+/*\n+ * Copyright (C) 2016 The Android Open Source Project\n+ *\n+ * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the \"License\");\n+ * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.\n+ * You may obtain a copy of the License at\n+ *\n+ *      http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0\n+ *\n+ * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software\n+ * distributed under the License is distributed on an \"AS IS\" BASIS,\n+ * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.\n+ * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and\n+ * limitations under the License.\n+ */\n+\n+package android.perftests.utils;\n+\n+import android.support.test.InstrumentationRegistry;\n+\n+import org.junit.rules.TestRule;\n+import org.junit.runner.Description;\n+import org.junit.runners.model.Statement;\n+\n+import static junit.framework.Assert.assertFalse;\n+import static junit.framework.Assert.assertTrue;\n+\n+/**\n+ * Use this rule to make sure we report the status after the test success.\n+ *\n+ * <code>\n+ *\n+ * @Rule public PerfStatusReporter mPerfStatusReporter = new PerfStatusReporter();\n+ * @Test public void functionName() {\n+ *     ...\n+ *     BenchmarkState state = mPerfStatusReporter.getBenchmarkState();\n+ *     while (state.keepRunning()) {\n+ *         // DO YOUR TEST HERE!\n+ *     }\n+ *     ...\n+ * }\n+ * </code>\n+ *\n+ * When test succeeded, the status report will use the key as\n+ * \"functionName[optional subTestName]_*\"\n+ *\n+ * Notice that optional subTestName can't be just numbers, that means each sub test needs to have a\n+ * name when using parameterization.\n+ */\n+\n+public class PerfStatusReporter implements TestRule {\n+    private final BenchmarkState mState = new BenchmarkState();\n+\n+    public BenchmarkState getBenchmarkState() {\n+        return mState;\n+    }\n+\n+    @Override\n+    public Statement apply(Statement base, Description description) {\n+        return new Statement() {\n+            @Override\n+            public void evaluate() throws Throwable {\n+                String invokeMethodName = description.getMethodName();\n+                // validate and simplify the function name.\n+                // First, remove the \"test\" prefix which normally comes from CTS test.\n+                // Then make sure the [subTestName] is valid, not just numbers like [0].\n+                if (invokeMethodName.startsWith(\"test\")) {\n+                    assertTrue(\"The test name \" + invokeMethodName + \" is too short\",\n+                            invokeMethodName.length() > 5);\n+                    invokeMethodName = invokeMethodName.substring(4, 5).toLowerCase()\n+                            + invokeMethodName.substring(5);\n+                }\n+\n+                int index = invokeMethodName.lastIndexOf('[');\n+                if (index > 0) {\n+                    boolean allDigits = true;\n+                    for (int i = index + 1; i < invokeMethodName.length() - 1; i++) {\n+                        if (!Character.isDigit(invokeMethodName.charAt(i))) {\n+                            allDigits = false;\n+                            break;\n+                        }\n+                    }\n+                    assertFalse(\"The name in [] can't contain only digits for \" + invokeMethodName,\n+                            allDigits);\n+                }\n+\n+                base.evaluate();\n+\n+                mState.sendFullStatusReport(InstrumentationRegistry.getInstrumentation(),\n+                        invokeMethodName);\n+            }\n+        };\n+    }\n+}"

            "patch": "@@ -1,9 +1,68 @@\n package android.app {\n \n+  public class Activity extends android.view.ContextThemeWrapper implements android.content.ComponentCallbacks2 android.view.KeyEvent.Callback android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2 android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener android.view.Window.Callback {\n+    method public deprecated boolean enterPictureInPictureMode(android.app.PictureInPictureArgs);\n+    method public deprecated void setPictureInPictureArgs(android.app.PictureInPictureArgs);\n+  }\n+\n+  public class ActivityManager {\n+    method public static deprecated int getMaxNumPictureInPictureActions();\n+  }\n+\n+  public class KeyguardManager {\n+    method public deprecated void dismissKeyguard(android.app.Activity, android.app.KeyguardManager.KeyguardDismissCallback, android.os.Handler);\n+  }\n+\n   public class Notification implements android.os.Parcelable {\n+    method public deprecated java.lang.String getChannel();\n+    method public deprecated long getTimeout();\n     method public deprecated void setLatestEventInfo(android.content.Context, java.lang.CharSequence, java.lang.CharSequence, android.app.PendingIntent);\n   }\n \n+  public static class Notification.Builder {\n+    method public deprecated android.app.Notification.Builder setChannel(java.lang.String);\n+    method public             "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,436 @@\n+/*\n+ * Copyright (C) 2007 The Android Open Source Project\n+ *\n+ * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the \"License\");\n+ * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.\n+ * You may obtain a copy of the License at\n+ *\n+ *      http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0\n+ *\n+ * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software\n+ * distributed under the License is distributed on an \"AS IS\" BASIS,\n+ * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.\n+ * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and\n+ * limitations under the License.\n+ */\n+\n+package com.android.commands.am;\n+\n+import android.app.IActivityManager;\n+import android.app.IInstrumentationWatcher;\n+import android.app.Instrumentation;\n+import android.app.UiAutomationConnection;\n+import android.content.ComponentName;\n+import android.content.pm.IPackageManager;\n+import android.content.pm.InstrumentationInfo;\n+import android.os.Build;\n+import android.os.Bundle;\n+import android.os.RemoteException;\n+import android.os.ServiceManager;\n+import android.os.UserHandle;\n+import android.util.AndroidException;\n+import android.util.proto.ProtoOutputStream;\n+import android.view.IWindowManager;\n+\n+import java.io.IOException;\n+import java.util.ArrayList;\n+import java.util.List;\n+\n+\n+/**\n+ * Runs the am instrument command\n+ */\n+public class Instrument {\n+    private final IActivityManager mAm;\n+    private final IPackageManager mPm;\n+    private final IWindowManager mWm;\n+\n+    // Command line arguments\n+    public String profileFile = null;\n+    public boolean wait = false;\n+    public boolean rawMode = false;\n+    public boolean proto = false;\n+    public boolean noWindowAnimation = false;\n+    public String abi = null;\n+    public int userId = UserHandle.USER_CURRENT;\n+    public Bundle args = new Bundle();\n+    // Required\n+    public String componentNameArg;\n+\n+    /**\n+     * Construct the instrument command runner.\n+     */\n+    public Instrument(IActivityManager am, IPackageManager pm) {\n+        mAm = am;\n+        mPm = pm;\n+        mWm = IWindowManager.Stub.asInterface(ServiceManager.getService(\"window\"));\n+    }\n+\n+    /**\n+     * Base class for status reporting.\n+     *\n+     * All the methods on this interface are called within the synchronized block\n+     * of the InstrumentationWatcher, so calls are in order.  However, that means\n+     * you must be careful not to do blocking operations because you don't know\n+     * exactly the locking dependencies.\n+     */\n+    private interface StatusReporter {\n+        /**\n+         * Status update for tests.\n+         */\n+        public void onInstrumentationStatusLocked(ComponentName name, int resultCode,\n+                Bundle results);\n+\n+        /**\n+         * The tests finished.\n+         */\n+        public void onInstrumentationFinishedLocked(ComponentName name, int resultCode,\n+                Bundle results);\n+\n+        /**\n+         * @param errorText a description of the error\n+         * @param commandError True if the error is related to the commandline, as opposed\n+         *      to a test failing.\n+         */\n+        public void onError(String errorText, boolean commandError);\n+    }\n+\n+    /**\n+     * Printer for the 'classic' text based status reporting.\n+     */\n+    private class TextStatusReporter implements StatusReporter {\n+        private boolean mRawMode;\n+\n+        /**\n+         * Human-ish readable output.\n+         *\n+         * @param rawMode   In \"raw mode\" (true), all bundles are dumped.\n+         *                  In \"pretty mode\" (false), if a bundle includes\n+         *                  Instrumentation.REPORT_KEY_STREAMRESULT, just print that.\n+         */\n+        public TextStatusReporter(boolean rawMode) {\n+            mRawMode = rawMode;\n+        }\n+\n+        @Override\n+        public void onInstrumentationStatusLocked(ComponentName name, int resultCode,\n+                Bundle results) {\n+            // pretty printer mode?\n+            String pretty = null;\n+            if (!mRawMode && results != null) {\n+                pretty = results.getString(Instrumentation.REPORT_KEY_STREAMRESULT);\n+            }\n+            if (pretty != null) {\n+                System.out.print(pretty);\n+            } else {\n+                if (results != null) {\n+                    for (String key : results.keySet()) {\n+                        System.out.println(\n+                                \"INSTRUMENTATION_STATUS: \" + key + \"=\" + results.get(key));\n+                    }\n+                }\n+                System.out.println(\"INSTRUMENTATION_STATUS_CODE: \" + resultCode);\n+            }\n+        }\n+\n+        @Override\n+        public void onInstrumentationFinishedLocked(ComponentName name, int resultCode,\n+                Bundle results) {\n+            // pretty printer mode?\n+            String pretty = null;\n+            if (!mRawMode && results != null) {\n+                pretty = results.getString(Instrumentation.REPORT_KEY_STREAMRESULT);\n+            }\n+            if (pretty != null) {\n+                System.out.println(pretty);\n+            } else {\n+                if (results != null) {\n+                    for (String key : results.keySet()) {\n+                        System.out.println(\n+                                \"INSTRUMENTATION_RESULT: \" + key + \"=\" + results.get(key));\n+                    }\n+                }\n+                System.out.println(\"INSTRUMENTATION_CODE: \" + resultCode);\n+            }\n+        }\n+\n+        @Override\n+        public void onError(String errorText, boolean commandError) {\n+            // The regular BaseCommand error printing will print the commandErrors.\n+            if (!commandError) {\n+                System.out.println(errorText);\n+            }\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+    /**\n+     * Printer for the protobuf based status reporting.\n+     */\n+    private class ProtoStatusReporter implements StatusReporter {\n+        @Override\n+        public void onInstrumentationStatusLocked(ComponentName name, int resultCode,\n+                Bundle results) {\n+            final ProtoOutputStream proto = new ProtoOutputStream();\n+\n+            final long token = proto.startRepeatedObject(InstrumentationData.Session.TEST_STATUS);\n+\n+            proto.writeSInt32(InstrumentationData.TestStatus.RESULT_CODE, resultCode);\n+            writeBundle(proto, InstrumentationData.TestStatus.RESULTS, results);\n+\n+            proto.endRepeatedObject(token);\n+            writeProtoToStdout(proto);\n+        }\n+\n+        @Override\n+        public void onInstrumentationFinishedLocked(ComponentName name, int resultCode,\n+                Bundle results) {\n+            final ProtoOutputStream proto = new ProtoOutputStream();\n+\n+            final long token = proto.startObject(InstrumentationData.Session.SESSION_STATUS);\n+\n+            proto.writeEnum(InstrumentationData.SessionStatus.STATUS_CODE,\n+                    InstrumentationData.SESSION_FINISHED);\n+            proto.writeSInt32(InstrumentationData.SessionStatus.RESULT_CODE, resultCode);\n+            writeBundle(proto, InstrumentationData.SessionStatus.RESULTS, results);\n+\n+            proto.endObject(token);\n+            writeProtoToStdout(proto);\n+        }\n+\n+        @Override\n+        public void onError(String errorText, boolean commandError) {\n+            final ProtoOutputStream proto = new ProtoOutputStream();\n+\n+            final long token = proto.startObject(InstrumentationData.Session.SESSION_STATUS);\n+\n+            proto.writeEnum(InstrumentationData.SessionStatus.STATUS_CODE,\n+                    InstrumentationData.SESSION_ABORTED);\n+            proto.writeString(InstrumentationData.SessionStatus.ERROR_TEXT, errorText);\n+\n+            proto.endObject(token);\n+            writeProtoToStdout(proto);\n+        }\n+\n+        private void writeBundle(ProtoOutputStream proto, long fieldId, Bundle bundle) {\n+            final long bundleToken = proto.startObject(fieldId);\n+\n+            for (final String key: bundle.keySet()) {\n+                final long entryToken = proto.startRepeatedObject(\n+                        InstrumentationData.ResultsBundle.ENTRIES);\n+\n+                proto.writeString(InstrumentationData.ResultsBundleEntry.KEY, key);\n+\n+                final Object val = bundle.get(key);\n+                if (val instanceof String) {\n+                    proto.writeString(InstrumentationData.ResultsBundleEntry.VALUE_STRING,\n+                            (String)val);\n+                } else if (val instanceof Byte) {\n+                    proto.writeSInt32(InstrumentationData.ResultsBundleEntry.VALUE_INT,\n+                            ((Byte)val).intValue());\n+                } else if (val instanceof Double) {\n+                    proto.writeDouble(InstrumentationData.ResultsBundleEntry.VALUE_DOUBLE,\n+                            ((Double)val).doubleValue());\n+                } else if (val instanceof Float) {\n+                    proto.writeFloat(InstrumentationData.ResultsBundleEntry.VALUE_FLOAT,\n+                            ((Float)val).floatValue());\n+                } else if (val instanceof Integer) {\n+                    proto.writeSInt32(InstrumentationData.ResultsBundleEntry.VALUE_INT,\n+                            ((Integer)val).intValue());\n+                } else if (val instanceof Long) {\n+                    proto.writeSInt64(InstrumentationData.ResultsBundleEntry.VALUE_LONG,\n+                            ((Long)val).longValue());\n+                } else if (val instanceof Short) {\n+                    proto.writeSInt32(InstrumentationData.ResultsBundleEntry.VALUE_INT,\n+                            ((Short)val).intValue());\n+                } else if (val instanceof Bundle) {\n+                    writeBundle(proto, InstrumentationData.ResultsBundleEntry.VALUE_BUNDLE,\n+                            (Bundle)val);\n+                }\n+\n+                proto.endRepeatedObject(entryToken);\n+            }\n+\n+            proto.endObject(bundleToken);\n+        }\n+\n+        private void writeProtoToStdout(ProtoOutputStream proto) {\n+            try {\n+                System.out.write(proto.getBytes());\n+                System.out.flush();\n+            } catch (IOException ex) {\n+                System.err.println(\"Error writing finished response: \");\n+                ex.printStackTrace(System.err);\n+            }\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+\n+    /**\n+     * Callbacks from the remote instrumentation instance.\n+     */\n+    private class InstrumentationWatcher extends IInstrumentationWatcher.Stub {\n+        private final StatusReporter mReporter;\n+\n+        private boolean mFinished = false;\n+\n+        public InstrumentationWatcher(StatusReporter reporter) {\n+            mReporter = reporter;\n+        }\n+\n+        @Override\n+        public void instrumentationStatus(ComponentName name, int resultCode, Bundle results) {\n+            synchronized (this) {\n+                mReporter.onInstrumentationStatusLocked(name, resultCode, results);\n+                notifyAll();\n+            }\n+        }\n+\n+        @Override\n+        public void instrumentationFinished(ComponentName name, int resultCode, Bundle results) {\n+            synchronized (this) {\n+                mReporter.onInstrumentationFinishedLocked(name, resultCode, results);\n+                mFinished = true;\n+                notifyAll();\n+            }\n+        }\n+\n+        public boolean waitForFinish() {\n+            synchronized (this) {\n+                while (!mFinished) {\n+                    try {\n+                        if (!mAm.asBinder().pingBinder()) {\n+                            return false;\n+                        }\n+                        wait(1000);\n+                    } catch (InterruptedException e) {\n+                        throw new IllegalStateException(e);\n+                    }\n+                }\n+            }\n+            return true;\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+    /**\n+     * Figure out which component they really meant.\n+     */\n+    private ComponentName parseComponentName(String cnArg) throws Exception {\n+        if (cnArg.contains(\"/\")) {\n+            ComponentName cn = ComponentName.unflattenFromString(cnArg);\n+            if (cn == null) throw new IllegalArgumentException(\"Bad component name: \" + cnArg);\n+            return cn;\n+        } else {\n+            List<InstrumentationInfo> infos = mPm.queryInstrumentation(null, 0).getList();\n+\n+            final int numInfos = infos == null ? 0: infos.size();\n+            ArrayList<ComponentName> cns = new ArrayList<>();\n+            for (int i = 0; i < numInfos; i++) {\n+                InstrumentationInfo info = infos.get(i);\n+\n+                ComponentName c = new ComponentName(info.packageName, info.name);\n+                if (cnArg.equals(info.packageName)) {\n+                    cns.add(c);\n+                }\n+            }\n+\n+            if (cns.size() == 0) {\n+                throw new IllegalArgumentException(\"No instrumentation found for: \" + cnArg);\n+            } else if (cns.size() == 1) {\n+                return cns.get(0);\n+            } else {\n+                StringBuilder cnsStr = new StringBuilder();\n+                final int numCns = cns.size();\n+                for (int i = 0; i < numCns; i++) {\n+                    cnsStr.append(cns.get(i).flattenToString());\n+                    cnsStr.append(\", \");\n+                }\n+\n+                // Remove last \", \"\n+                cnsStr.setLength(cnsStr.length() - 2);\n+\n+                throw new IllegalArgumentException(\"Found multiple instrumentations: \"\n+                        + cnsStr.toString());\n+            }\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+    /**\n+     * Run the instrumentation.\n+     */\n+    public void run() throws Exception {\n+        StatusReporter reporter = null;\n+        float[] oldAnims = null;\n+\n+        try {\n+            // Choose which output we will do.\n+            if (proto) {\n+                reporter = new ProtoStatusReporter();\n+            } else if (wait) {\n+                reporter = new TextStatusReporter(rawMode);\n+            }\n+\n+            // Choose whether we have to wait for the results.\n+            InstrumentationWatcher watcher = null;\n+ AndroidException(\"INSTRUMENTATION_FAILED: \" + cn.flattenToString());\n+            }\n+\n+            // If we have been requested to wait, do so until the instrumentation is finished.\n+            if (watcher != null) {\n+                if (!watcher.waitForFinish()) {\n+                    reporter.onError(\"INSTRUMENTATION_ABORTED: System has crashed.\", false);\n+                    return;\n+                }\n+            }\n+        } catch (Exception ex) {\n+            // Report failures\n+            if (reporter != null) {\n+                reporter.onError(ex.getMessage(), true);\n+            }\n+\n+            // And re-throw the exception\n+            throw ex;\n+        } finally {\n+            // Clean up\n+            if }\n+\n+bool BootAnimation::playSoundsAllowed() const {\n+    // Only play sounds for system boots, not runtime restarts.\n+    if (!mSystemBoot) {\n+        return false;\n+    }\n+    if (mShuttingDown) { // no audio while shutting down\n+        return false;\n+    }\n+    // Read the system property to see if we should play the sound.\n+    // If it's not present, default to allowed.\n+    if (!property_get_bool(PLAY_SOUND_PROP_NAME, 1)) {\n+        return false;\n+    }\n+\n+    // Don't play sounds if this is a reboot due to an error.\n+    char bootreason[PROPERTY_VALUE_MAX];\n+    if (property_get(BOOTREASON_PROP_NAME, bootreason, nullptr) > 0) {\n+        for (const auto& str : PLAY_SOUND_BOOTREASON_BLACKLIST) {\n+            if {\n+        return true;\n+    }\n+    if (mShuttingDown) return true;\n+    struct stat statResult;\n+\n+    if(stat(TIME_FORMAT_12_HOUR_FLAG_FILE_PATH, &statResult) == 0) {\n+ fopen(LAST_TIME_CHANGED_FILE_PATH, \"r\");\n+    if (file != NULL) {\n+      long long lastChangedTime = 0;\n+      fscanf(file, \"%lld\", &lastChangedTime);\n+      fclose(file);\n+      if (lastChangedTime > 0) {\n+        struct timespec now;\n+        clock_gettime(CLOCK_REALTIME, &now);\n+        // Match the Java timestamp format\n+        long long rtcNow = (now.tv_sec * 1000LL) + (now.tv_nsec / 1000000LL);\n+        if (ACCURATE_TIME_EPOCH < rtcNow\n+            && lastChangedTime > (rtcNow - MAX_TIME_IN_PAST)\n+            && lastChangedTime < (rtcNow + MAX_TIME_IN_FUTURE)) {\n+            mTimeIsAccurate = true;\n+        }\n+      }\n+    }\n+\n+    return mTimeIsAccurate;\n+}\n+\n+BootAnimation::TimeCheckThread::TimeCheckThread(BootAnimation* bootAnimation) : since we're not at risk of attempting to close a valid FD.\n+    close(mInotifyFd);\n+}\n+\n+bool BootAnimation::TimeCheckThread::threadLoop() {\n+    bool shouldLoop = doThreadLoop() && !mBootAnimation->mTimeIsAccurate\n+        && mBootAnimation->mClockEnabled;\n+    if (!shouldLoop) {\n+        close(mInotifyFd);\n+        mInotifyFd = -1;\n+    }\n+    return shouldLoop;\n+}\n+\n+bool BootAnimation::TimeCheckThread::doThreadLoop() {\n+    static constexpr int BUFF_LEN (10 * (sizeof(struct inotify_event) + NAME_MAX + 1));\n+\n+    // Poll instead of doing a blocking read so the Thread can exit if requested.\n+    struct pollfd pfd = { mInotifyFd, POLLIN, 0 };\n+    ssize_t pollResult = poll(&pfd, 1, 1000);\n+\n+    if (pollResult == 0) {\n+        return true;\n+    } else if (pollResult < 0) {\n+        ALOGE(\"Could not poll inotify events\");\n+        return false;\n+    }\n+\n+    char buff[BUFF_LEN] __attribute__ ((aligned(__alignof__(struct inotify_event))));;\n+    ssize_t length = read(mInotifyFd, buff, BUFF_LEN);\n+    if (length == 0) {\n+        return true;\n+    } else if (length < 0) {\n+        ALOGE(\"Could not read inotify events\");\n+        return false;\n+    }\n+\n+    const struct inotify_event *event;\n+    for (char* ptr = buff; ptr < buff + length; ptr += sizeof(struct inotify_event) + event->len) {\n+        event = (const struct inotify_event *) ptr;\n+        if (event->wd == mSystemWd && strcmp(SYSTEM_TIME_DIR_NAME, event->name) == 0) {\n+            addTimeDirWatch();\n+        } else if (event->wd == mTimeWd && (strcmp(LAST_TIME_CHANGED_FILE_NAME, event->name) == 0\n+                || strcmp(ACCURATE_TIME_FLAG_FILE_NAME, event->name) == 0)) {\n+            return !mBootAnimation->updateIsTimeAccurate();\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+    return true;\n+}\n+\n+void BootAnimation::TimeCheckThread::addTimeDirWatch() {\n+        mTimeWd = inotify_add_watch(mInotifyFd, SYSTEM_TIME_DIR_PATH,\n+                IN_CLOSE_WRITE | IN_MOVED_TO | IN_ATTRIB);\n+        if (mTimeWd > 0) {\n+            // No need to watch for the time directory to be created if it already exists\n+            inotify_rm_watch(mInotifyFd, mSystemWd);\n+            mSystemWd = -1;\n+        }\n+}\n+\n+status_t BootAnimation::TimeCheckThread::readyToRun() {\n+    mInotifyFd = inotify_init();\n+    if (mInotifyFd < 0) {\n+        ALOGE(\"Could not initialize inotify fd\");\n+        return NO_INIT;\n+    }\n+\n+    mSystemWd = inotify_add_watch(mInotifyFd, SYSTEM_DATA_DIR_PATH, IN_CREATE | IN_ATTRIB);\n+    if (mSystemWd < 0) {\n+        close(mInotifyFd);\n+        mInotifyFd = -1;\n+        ALOGE(\"Could not add watch for %s\", SYSTEM_DATA_DIR_PATH);\n+        return NO_INIT;\n+    }\n+\n+    addTimeDirWatch();\n+\n+    if (mBootAnimation->updateIsTimeAccurate()) {\n+        close(mInotifyFd);\n+        mInotifyFd = -1;\n+        return ALREADY_EXISTS;\n+    }\n+\n+    return NO_ERROR;\n+}\n+\n+BootAnimation::InitAudioThread::InitAudioThread(uint8_t* exampleAudioData, int exampleAudioLength)\n+    : Thread(false),\n+ mExampleAudioLength);\n+    // Exit immediately\n+    return false;\n+}\n+\n // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------\n \n }"

            "status": "added",

            "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/android/platform_frameworks_base/contents/cmds/bootanimation/FORMAT.md?ref=899eecd41a6bf506766dfa64f9f17173add74cbc",
            "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,101 @@\n+# bootanimation format\n+\n+## zipfile paths\n+\n+The system selects a boot animation zipfile from the following locations, in order:\n+\n+    /system/media/bootanimation-encrypted.zip (if getprop(\"vold.decrypt\") = '1')\n+    /system/media/bootanimation.zip\n+    /oem/media/bootanimation.zip\n+\n+## zipfile layout\n+\n+The `bootanimation.zip` archive file includes:\n+\n+    desc.txt - a text file\n+    part0  \\\n+    part1   \\  directories full of PNG frames\n+    ...     /\n+    partN  /\n+\n+## desc.txt format\n+\n+The first line defines the general parameters of the animation:\n+\n+    WIDTH HEIGHT FPS\n+\n+  * **WIDTH:** animation width (pixels)\n+  * **HEIGHT:** animation height (pixels)\n+  * **FPS:** frames per second, e.g. 60\n+\n+It is followed by a number of rows of the form:\n+\n+    TYPE COUNT PAUSE PATH [#RGBHEX CLOCK]\n+\n+  * **TYPE:** a single char indicating what type of animation segment this is:\n+      + `p` -- this part will play unless interrupted by the end of the boot\n+      + `c` -- this part will play to completion, no matter what\n+  * **COUNT:** how many times to play the animation, or 0 to loop forever until boot is complete\n+  * **PAUSE:** number of FRAMES to delay after this part ends\n+  * **PATH:** directory in which to find the frames for this part (e.g. `part0`)\n+  * **RGBHEX:** _(OPTIONAL)_ a background color, specified as `#RRGGBB`\n+  * **CLOCK:** _(OPTIONAL)_ the y-coordinate at which to draw the current time (for watches)\n+\n+There is also a special TYPE, `$SYSTEM`, that loads `/system/media/bootanimation.zip`\n+and plays that.\n+\n+## loading and playing frames\n+\n+Each part is scanned and loaded directly from the zip archive. Within a part directory, every file\n+(except `trim.txt` and `audio.wav`; see next sections) is expected to be a PNG file that represents\n+one frame in that part (at the specified resolution). For this reason it is important that frames be\n+named sequentially (e.g. `part000.png`, `part001.png`, ...) and added to the zip archive in that\n+order.\n+\n+## trim.txt\n+\n+To save on memory, textures may be trimmed by their background color.  trim.txt sequentially lists\n+the trim output for each frame in its directory, so the frames may be properly positioned.\n+Output should be of the form: `WxH+X+Y`. Example:\n+\n+    713x165+388+914\n+    708x152+388+912\n+    707x139+388+911\n+    649x92+388+910\n+\n+If the file is not present, each frame is assumed to be the same size as the animation.\n+\n+## audio.wav\n+\n+Each part may optionally play a `wav` sample when it starts. To enable this, add a file\n+with the name `audio.wav` in the part directory.\n+\n+## exiting\n+\n+The system will end the boot animation (first completing any incomplete or even entirely unplayed\n+parts that are of type `c`) when the system is finished booting. (This is accomplished by setting\n+the system property `service.bootanim.exit` to a nonzero string.)\n+\n+## protips\n+\n+### PNG compression\n+\n+Use `zopflipng` if you have it, otherwise `pngcrush` will do. e.g.:\n+\n+    for fn in *.png ; do\n+        zopflipng -m ${fn}s ${fn}s.new && mv -f ${fn}s.new ${fn}\n+        # or: pngcrush -q ....\n+    done\n+\n+Some animations benefit from being reduced to 256 colors:\n+\n+    pngquant --force --ext .png *.png\n+    # alternatively: mogrify -colors 256 anim-tmp/*/*.png\n+\n+### creating the ZIP archive\n+\n+    cd <path-to-pieces>\n+    zip -0qry -i \\*.txt \\*.png \\*.wav @ ../bootanimation.zip *.txt part*\n+\n+Note that the ZIP archive is not actually compressed! The PNG files are already as compressed\n+as they can reasonably get, and there is unlikely to be any redundancy between files."
        },

            "raw_url": "https://github.com/android/platform_frameworks_base/raw/899eecd41a6bf506766dfa64f9f17173add74cbc/cmds/bootanimation/audioplay.cpp",
            "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/android/platform_frameworks_base/contents/cmds/bootanimation/audioplay.cpp?ref=899eecd41a6bf506766dfa64f9f17173add74cbc",
            "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,400 @@\n+/*\n+ * Copyright (C) 2016 The Android Open Source Project\n+ *\n+ * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the \"License\");\n+ * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.\n+ * You may obtain a copy of the License at\n+ *\n+ *      http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0\n+ *\n+ * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software\n+ * distributed under the License is distributed on an \"AS IS\" BASIS,\n+ * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.\n+ * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and\n+ * limitations under the License.\n+ *\n+ */\n+\n+// cribbed from samples/native-audio\n+\n+#include \"audioplay.h\"\n+\n+#define CHATTY ALOGD\n+#define LOG_TAG \"audioplay\"\n+\n+#include <string.h>\n+\n+#include <utils/Log.h>\n+\n+// for native audio\n+#include <SLES/OpenSLES.h>\n+#include <SLES/OpenSLES_Android.h>\n+\n+namespace audioplay {\n+namespace {\n+\n+// engine interfaces\n+static SLObjectItf engineObject = NULL;\n+static SLEngineItf engineEngine;\n+\n+// output mix interfaces\n+static SLObjectItf outputMixObject = NULL;\n+\n+// buffer queue player interfaces\n+static SLObjectItf bqPlayerObject = NULL;\n+static SLPlayItf bqPlayerPlay;\n+static SLAndroidSimpleBufferQueueItf bqPlayerBufferQueue;\n+static SLMuteSoloItf bqPlayerMuteSolo;\n+static SLVolumeItf bqPlayerVolume;\n+\n+// pointer and size of the next player buffer to enqueue, and number of remaining buffers\n+static const uint8_t* nextBuffer;\n+static unsigned nextSize;\n+\n+static const uint32_t ID_RIFF = 0x46464952;\n+static const uint32_t ID_WAVE = 0x45564157;\n+static const uint32_t ID_FMT  = 0x20746d66;\n+static const uint32_t ID_DATA = 0x61746164;\n+\n+struct RiffWaveHeader {\n+    uint32_t riff_id;\n+    uint32_t riff_sz;\n+    uint32_t wave_id;\n+};\n+\n+struct ChunkHeader {\n+    uint32_t id;\n+    uint32_t sz;\n+};\n+\n+struct ChunkFormat {\n+    uint16_t audio_format;\n+    uint16_t num_channels;\n+    uint32_t sample_rate;\n+    uint32_t byte_rate;\n+    uint16_t block_align;\n+    uint16_t bits_per_sample;\n+};\n+\n+// this callback handler is called every time a buffer finishes playing\n+void bqPlayerCallback(SLAndroidSimpleBufferQueueItf bq, void *context) {\n+    (void)bq;\n+    (void)context;\n+    audioplay::setPlaying(false);\n+}\n+\n+bool hasPlayer() {\n+    return (engineObject != NULL && bqPlayerObject != NULL);\n+}\n+\n+// create the engine and output mix objects\n+bool createEngine() {\n+    SLresult result;\n+\n+    // create engine\n+    result = slCreateEngine(&engineObject, 0, NULL, 0, NULL, NULL);\n+    if (result != SL_RESULT_SUCCESS) {\n+        ALOGE(\"slCreateEngine failed with result %d\", result);\n+        return false;\n+    }\n+    (void)result;\n+\n+    // realize the engine\n+    result = (*engineObject)->Realize(engineObject, SL_BOOLEAN_FALSE);\n+    if (result != SL_RESULT_SUCCESS) {\n+        ALOGE(\"sl engine Realize failed with result %d\", result);\n+        return false;\n+    }\n+    (void)result;\n+\n+    // get the engine interface, which is needed in order to create other objects\n+    result = (*engineObject)->GetInterface(engineObject, SL_IID_ENGINE, &engineEngine);\n+    if (result != SL_RESULT_SUCCESS) {\n+        ALOGE(\"sl engine GetInterface failed with result %d\", result);\n+        return false;\n+    }\n+    (void)result;\n+\n+    // create output mix\n+    result = (*engineEngine)->CreateOutputMix(engineEngine, &outputMixObject, 0, NULL, NULL);\n+    if (result != SL_RESULT_SUCCESS) {\n+        ALOGE(\"sl engine CreateOutputMix failed with result %d\", result);\n+        return false;\n+    }\n+    (void)result;\n+\n+    // realize the output mix\n+    result = (*outputMixObject)->Realize(outputMixObject, SL_BOOLEAN_FALSE);\n+    if (result != SL_RESULT_SUCCESS) {\n+        ALOGE(\"sl outputMix Realize failed with result %d\", result);\n+        return false;\n+    }\n+    (void)result;\n+\n+    return true;\n+}\n+\n+// create buffer queue audio player\n+bool createBufferQueueAudioPlayer(const ChunkFormat* chunkFormat) {\n+    SLresult result;\n+\n+    // configure audio source\n+    SLDataLocator_AndroidSimpleBufferQueue loc_bufq = {SL_DATALOCATOR_ANDROIDSIMPLEBUFFERQUEUE, 1};\n+\n+    // Determine channelMask from num_channels\n+    SLuint32 channelMask;\n+    switch (chunkFormat->num_channels) {\n+        case 1:\n+            channelMask = SL_SPEAKER_FRONT_CENTER;\n+            break;\n+        case 2:\n+            channelMask = SL_SPEAKER_FRONT_LEFT | SL_SPEAKER_FRONT_RIGHT;\n+            break;\n+        default:\n+            // Default of 0 will derive mask from num_channels and log a warning.\n+            channelMask = 0;\n+    }\n+\n+    SLDataFormat_PCM format_pcm = {\n+        SL_DATAFORMAT_PCM,\n+        chunkFormat->num_channels,\n+        chunkFormat->sample_rate * 1000,  // convert to milliHz\n+        chunkFormat->bits_per_sample,\n+        16,\n+        channelMask,\n+        SL_BYTEORDER_LITTLEENDIAN\n+    };\n+    SLDataSource audioSrc = {&loc_bufq, &format_pcm};\n+\n+    // configure audio sink\n+    SLDataLocator_OutputMix loc_outmix = {SL_DATALOCATOR_OUTPUTMIX, outputMixObject};\n+    SLDataSink audioSnk = {&loc_outmix, NULL};\n+\n+    // create audio player\n+    const SLInterfaceID ids[3] = {SL_IID_BUFFERQUEUE, SL_IID_VOLUME, SL_IID_ANDROIDCONFIGURATION};\n+    const SLboolean req[3] = {SL_BOOLEAN_TRUE, SL_BOOLEAN_TRUE, SL_BOOLEAN_TRUE};\n+    result = (*engineEngine)->CreateAudioPlayer(engineEngine, &bqPlayerObject, &audioSrc, &audioSnk,\n+            3, ids, req);\n+    if (result != SL_RESULT_SUCCESS) {\n+        ALOGE(\"sl CreateAudioPlayer failed with result %d\", result);\n+        return false;\n+    }\n+    (void)result;\n+\n+    // Use the System stream for boot sound playback.\n+    SLAndroidConfigurationItf playerConfig;\n+    result = (*bqPlayerObject)->GetInterface(bqPlayerObject,\n+        SL_IID_ANDROIDCONFIGURATION, &playerConfig);\n+    if (result != SL_RESULT_SUCCESS) {\n+        ALOGE(\"config GetInterface failed with result %d\", result);\n+        return false;\n+    }\n+    SLint32 streamType = SL_ANDROID_STREAM_SYSTEM;\n+    result = (*playerConfig)->SetConfiguration(playerConfig,\n+        SL_ANDROID_KEY_STREAM_TYPE, &streamType, sizeof(SLint32));\n+    if (result != SL_RESULT_SUCCESS) {\n+        ALOGE(\"SetConfiguration failed with result %d\", result);\n+        return false;\n+    }\n+    // use normal performance mode as low latency is not needed. This is not mandatory so\n+    // do not bail if we fail\n+    SLuint32 performanceMode = SL_ANDROID_PERFORMANCE_NONE;\n+    result = (*playerConfig)->SetConfiguration(\n+           playerConfig, SL_ANDROID_KEY_PERFORMANCE_MODE, &performanceMode, sizeof(SLuint32));\n+    ALOGW_IF(result != SL_RESULT_SUCCESS,\n+            \"could not set performance mode on player, error %d\", result);\n+    (void)result;\n+\n+    // realize the player\n+    result = (*bqPlayerObject)->Realize(bqPlayerObject, SL_BOOLEAN_FALSE);\n+    if (result != SL_RESULT_SUCCESS) {\n+        ALOGE(\"sl player Realize failed with result %d\", result);\n+        return false;\n+    }\n+    (void)result;\n+\n+    // get the play interface\n+    result = (*bqPlayerObject)->GetInterface(bqPlayerObject, SL_IID_PLAY, &bqPlayerPlay);\n+    if (result != SL_RESULT_SUCCESS) {\n+        ALOGE(\"sl player GetInterface failed with result %d\", result);\n+        return false;\n+    }\n+    (void)result;\n+\n+    // get the buffer queue interface\n+    result = (*bqPlayerObject)->GetInterface(bqPlayerObject, SL_IID_BUFFERQUEUE,\n+            &bqPlayerBufferQueue);\n+    if (result != SL_RESULT_SUCCESS) {\n+        ALOGE(\"sl playberBufferQueue GetInterface failed with result %d\", result);\n+        return false;\n+    }\n+    (void)result;\n+\n+    // register callback on the buffer queue\n+    result = (*bqPlayerBufferQueue)->RegisterCallback(bqPlayerBufferQueue, bqPlayerCallback, NULL);\n+    if (result != SL_RESULT_SUCCESS) {\n+        ALOGE(\"sl bqPlayerBufferQueue RegisterCallback failed with result %d\", result);\n+        return false;\n+    }\n+    (void)result;\n+\n+    // get the volume interface\n+    result = (*bqPlayerObject)->GetInterface(bqPlayerObject, SL_IID_VOLUME, &bqPlayerVolume);\n+    if (result != SL_RESULT_SUCCESS) {\n+        ALOGE(\"sl volume GetInterface failed with result %d\", result);\n+        return false;\n+    }\n+    (void)result;\n+\n+    // set the player's state to playing\n+    audioplay::setPlaying(true);\n+    CHATTY(\"Created buffer queue player: %p\", bqPlayerBufferQueue);\n+    return true;\n+}\n+\n+bool parseClipBuf(const uint8_t* clipBuf, int clipBufSize, const ChunkFormat** oChunkFormat,\n+                  const uint8_t** oSoundBuf, unsigned* oSoundBufSize) {\n+    *oSoundBuf = clipBuf;\n+    *oSoundBufSize = clipBufSize;\n+    *oChunkFormat = NULL;\n+    const RiffWaveHeader* wavHeader = (const RiffWaveHeader*)*oSoundBuf;\n+    if (*oSoundBufSize < sizeof(*wavHeader) || (wavHeader->riff_id != ID_RIFF) ||\n+        (wavHeader->wave_id != ID_WAVE)) {\n+        ALOGE(\"Error: audio file is not a riff/wave file\\n\");\n+        return false;\n+    }\n+    *oSoundBuf += sizeof(*wavHeader);\n+    *oSoundBufSize -= sizeof(*wavHeader);\n+\n+    while (true) {\n+        const ChunkHeader* chunkHeader = (const ChunkHeader*)*oSoundBuf;\n+        if (*oSoundBufSize < sizeof(*chunkHeader)) {\n+            ALOGE(\"EOF reading chunk headers\");\n+            return false;\n+        }\n+\n+        *oSoundBuf += sizeof(*chunkHeader);\n+        *oSoundBufSize -= sizeof(*chunkHeader);\n+\n+        bool endLoop = false;\n+        switch (chunkHeader->id) {\n+            case ID_FMT:\n+                *oChunkFormat = (const ChunkFormat*)*oSoundBuf;\n+                *oSoundBuf += chunkHeader->sz;\n+                *oSoundBufSize -= chunkHeader->sz;\n+                break;\n+            case ID_DATA:\n+                /* Stop looking for chunks */\n+                *oSoundBufSize = chunkHeader->sz;\n+                endLoop = true;\n+                break;\n+            default:\n+                /* Unknown chunk, skip bytes */\n+                *oSoundBuf += chunkHeader->sz;\n+                *oSoundBufSize -= chunkHeader->sz;\n+        }\n+        if (endLoop) {\n+            break;\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+    if (*oChunkFormat == NULL) {\n+        ALOGE(\"format not found in WAV file\");\n+        return false;\n+    }\n+    return true;\n+}\n+\n+} // namespace\n+\n+bool create(const uint8_t* exampleClipBuf, int exampleClipBufSize) {\n+    if (!createEngine()) {\n+        return false;\n+    }\n+\n+    // Parse the example clip.\n+    const ChunkFormat* chunkFormat;\n+    const uint8_t* soundBuf;\n+    unsigned soundBufSize;\n+    if (!parseClipBuf(exampleClipBuf, exampleClipBufSize, &chunkFormat, &soundBuf, &soundBufSize)) {\n+        return false;\n+    }\n+\n+    // Initialize the BufferQueue based on this clip's format.\n+    if (!createBufferQueueAudioPlayer(chunkFormat)) {\n+        return false;\n+    }\n+    return true;\n+}\n+\n+bool playClip(const uint8_t* buf, int size) {\n+    // Parse the WAV header\n+    const ChunkFormat* chunkFormat;\n+    if (!parseClipBuf(buf, size, &chunkFormat, &nextBuffer, &nextSize)) {\n+        return false;\n+    }\n+\n+    if (!hasPlayer()) {\n+        ALOGD(\"cannot play clip %p without a player\", buf);\n+        return false;\n+    }\n+\n+    CHATTY(\"playClip on player %p: buf=%p size=%d nextSize %d\",\n+           bqPlayerBufferQueue, buf, size, nextSize);\n+\n+    if (nextSize > 0) {\n+        // here we only enqueue one buffer because it is a long clip,\n+        // but for streaming playback we would typically enqueue at least 2 buffers to start\n+        SLresult result;\n+        result = (*bqPlayerBufferQueue)->Enqueue(bqPlayerBufferQueue, nextBuffer, nextSize);\n+        if (SL_RESULT_SUCCESS != result) {\n+            return false;\n+        }\n+        audioplay::setPlaying(true);\n+    }\n+\n+    return true;\n+}\n+\n+// set the playing state for the buffer queue audio player\n+void setPlaying(bool isPlaying) {\n+    if (!hasPlayer()) return;\n+\n+    SLresult result;\n+\n+    if (NULL != bqPlayerPlay) {\n+        // set the player's state\n+        result = (*bqPlayerPlay)->SetPlayState(bqPlayerPlay,\n+            isPlaying ? SL_PLAYSTATE_PLAYING : SL_PLAYSTATE_STOPPED);\n+    }\n+\n+}\n+\n+void destroy() {\n+    // destroy buffer queue audio player object, and invalidate all associated interfaces\n+    if (bqPlayerObject != NULL) {\n+        CHATTY(\"destroying audio player\");\n+        (*bqPlayerObject)->Destroy(bqPlayerObject);\n+        bqPlayerObject = NULL;\n+        bqPlayerPlay = NULL;\n+        bqPlayerBufferQueue = NULL;\n+        bqPlayerMuteSolo = NULL;\n+        bqPlayerVolume = NULL;\n+    }\n+\n+    // destroy output mix object, and invalidate all associated interfaces\n+    if (outputMixObject != NULL) {\n+        (*outputMixObject)->Destroy(outputMixObject);\n+        outputMixObject = NULL;\n+    }\n+\n+    // destroy engine object, and invalidate all associated interfaces\n+    if (engineObject != NULL) {\n+        CHATTY(\"destroying audio engine\");\n+        (*engineObject)->Destroy(engineObject);\n+        engineObject = NULL;\n+        engineEngine = NULL;\n+    }\n+}\n+\n+}  // namespace audioplay"

<android/os/BnIncidentReportStatusListener.h>\n+#include <android/os/IIncidentManager.h>\n+#include <android/os/IncidentReportArgs.h>\n+#include <binder/IPCThreadState.h>\n+#include <binder/IServiceManager.h>\n+#include <utils/Looper.h>\n+\n+#include <fcntl.h>\n+#include <getopt.h>\n+#include <stdio.h>\n+#include <stdlib.h>\n+#include <unistd.h>\n+\n+using namespace android;\n+using namespace android::base;\n+using namespace android::binder;\n+using namespace android::os;\n+\n+// ================================================================================\n+class StatusListener : public BnIncidentReportStatusListener {\n+public:\n+    StatusListener();\n+    virtual ~StatusListener();\n+\n+    virtual Status onReportStarted();\n+    virtual Status onReportSectionStatus(int32_t section, int32_t status);\n+    virtual Status onReportServiceStatus(const String16& service, int32_t status);\n+    virtual Status onReportFinished();\n+    virtual Status onReportFailed();\n+};\n+\n+StatusListener::StatusListener()\n+{\n+}\n+\n+StatusListener::~StatusListener()\n+{\n+}\n+\n+Status\n+StatusListener::onReportStarted()\n+{\n+    return Status::ok();\n+}\n+\n+Status\n+StatusListener::onReportSectionStatus(int32_t section, int32_t status)\n+{\n+    fprintf(stderr, \"section %d status %d\\n\", section, status);\n+    return Status::ok();\n+}\n+\n+Status\n+StatusListener::onReportServiceStatus(const String16& service, int32_t status)\n+{\n+    fprintf(stderr, \"service '%s' status %d\\n\", String8(service).string(), status);\n+    return Status::ok();\n+}\n+\n+Status\n+StatusListener::onReportFinished()\n+{\n+    fprintf(stderr, \"done\\n\");\n+    exit(0);\n+    return Status::ok();\n+}\n+\n+Status\n+StatusListener::onReportFailed()\n+{\n+    fprintf(stderr, \"failed\\n\");\n+    exit(1);\n+    return Status::ok();\n+}\n+\n+// ================================================================================\n+static IncidentSection const*\n+find_section(const char* name)\n+{\n+    size_t low = 0;\n+    size_t high = INCIDENT_SECTION_COUNT - 1;\n+\n+    while (low <= high) {\n+        size_t mid = (low + high) >> 1;\n+        IncidentSection const* section = INCIDENT_SECTIONS + mid;\n+\n+        int cmp = strcmp(section->name, name);\n+        if (cmp < 0) {\n+            low = mid + 1;\n+        } else if (cmp > 0) {\n+            high = mid - 1;\n+        } else {\n+            return section;\n+        }\n+    }\n+    return NULL;\n+}\n+\n+// ================================================================================\n+static void\n+usage(FILE* out)\n+{\n+    fprintf(out, \"usage: incident OPTIONS [SECTION...]\\n\");\n+    fprintf(out, \"\\n\");\n+    fprintf(out, \"Takes an incident report.\\n\");\n+    fprintf(out, \"\\n\");\n+    fprintf(out, \"OPTIONS\\n\");\n+    fprintf(out, \"  -b           (default) print the report to stdout (in proto format)\\n\");\n+    fprintf(out, \"  -d           send the report into dropbox\\n\");\n+    fprintf(out, \"\\n\");\n+    fprintf(out, \"  SECTION     the field numbers of the incident report fields to include\\n\");\n+    fprintf(out, \"\\n\");\n+}\n+\n+int\n+main(int argc, char** argv)\n+{\n+    Status status;\n+    IncidentReportArgs args;\n+    enum { DEST_DROPBOX, DEST_STDOUT } destination = DEST_STDOUT;\n+\n+    // Parse the args\n+    int opt;\n+    while ((opt = getopt(argc, argv, \"bhd\")) != -1) {\n+        switch (opt) {\n+            case 'b':\n+                destination = DEST_STDOUT;\n+                break;\n+            case 'h':\n+                usage(stdout);\n+                return 0;\n+            case 'd':\n+                destination = DEST_DROPBOX;\n+                break;\n+            default:\n+                usage(stderr);\n+                return 1;\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+    if (optind == argc) {\n+        args.setAll(true);\n+    } else {\n+        for (int i=optind; i<argc; i++) {\n+            const char* arg = argv[i];\n+            char* end;\n+            if (arg[0] != '\\0') {\n+                int section = strtol(arg, &end, 0);\n+                if (*end == '\\0') {\n+                    args.addSection(section);\n+                } else {\n+                    IncidentSection const* ic = find_section(arg);\n+                    if (ic == NULL) {\n+                        fprintf(stderr, \"Invalid section: %s\\n\", arg);\n+                        return 1;\n+                    }\n+                    args.addSection(ic->id);\n+                }\n+            }\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+\n+\n+    // Start the thread pool.\n+    sp<ProcessState> ps(ProcessState::self());\n+    ps->startThreadPool();\n+    ps->giveThreadPoolName();\n+\n+    // Look up the service\n+    sp<IIncidentManager> service = interface_cast<IIncidentManager>(\n+            defaultServiceManager()->getService(android::String16(\"incident\")));\n+    if (service == NULL) {\n+        fprintf(stderr, \"Couldn't look up the incident service\\n\");\n+        return 1;\n+    }\n+\n+    // Construct the stream\n+    int fds[2];\n+    pipe(fds);\n+\n+    unique_fd readEnd(fds[0]);\n+    unique_fd writeEnd(fds[1]);\n+\n+    if (destination == DEST_STDOUT) {\n+        // Call into the service\n+        sp<StatusListener> listener(new StatusListener());\n+        status = service->reportIncidentToStream(args, listener, writeEnd);\n+\n+        if (!status.isOk()) {\n+            fprintf(stderr, \"reportIncident returned \\\"%s\\\"\\n\", status.toString8().string());\n+        }\n+\n+        // Wait for the result and print out the data they send.\n+        //IPCThreadState::self()->joinThreadPool();\n+\n+        while (true) {\n+            int amt = splice(fds[0], NULL, STDOUT_FILENO, NULL, 4096, 0);\n+            fprintf(stderr, \"spliced %d bytes\\n\", amt);\n+            if (amt < 0) {\n+                return errno;\n+            } else if (amt == 0) {\n+                return 0;\n+            }\n+        }\n+    } else {\n+        status = service->reportIncident(args);\n+        if (!status.isOk()) {\n+            fprintf(stderr, \"reportIncident returned \\\"%s\\\"\\n\", status.toString8().string());\n+            return 1;\n+        } else {\n+            return 0;\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+}"

License for the specific language governing permissions and\n+ * limitations under the License.\n+ */\n+\n+#define LOG_TAG \"incidentd\"\n+\n+#include \"FdBuffer.h\"\n+\n+#include <cutils/log.h>\n+#include <utils/SystemClock.h>\n+\n+#include <fcntl.h>\n+#include <poll.h>\n+#include <unistd.h>\n+\n+const ssize_t BUFFER_SIZE = 16 * 1024;\n+const ssize_t MAX_BUFFER_COUNT = 256; // 4 MB max\n+\n+\n+FdBuffer::FdBuffer()\n+    :mBuffers(),\n+     mStartTime(-1),\n+     mFinishTime(-1),\n+     mCurrentWritten(-1),\n+     mTimedOut(false),\n+     mTruncated(false)\n+{\n+}\n+\n+FdBuffer::~FdBuffer()\n+{\n+    const int N = mBuffers.size();\n+    for (int i=0; i<N; i++) {\n+        uint8_t* buf = mBuffers[i];\n+        free(buf);\n+    }\n+}\n+\n+status_t\n+FdBuffer::read(int fd, int64_t timeout)\n+{\n+    struct pollfd pfds = {\n+        .fd = fd,\n+        .events = POLLIN\n+    };\n+    mStartTime = uptimeMillis();\n+\n+    fcntl(fd, F_SETFL, fcntl(fd, F_GETFL, 0) | O_NONBLOCK);\n+\n+    uint8_t* buf = NULL;\n+    while (true) {\n+        if (mCurrentWritten >= BUFFER_SIZE || mCurrentWritten < 0) {\n+            if (mBuffers.size() == MAX_BUFFER_COUNT) {\n+                mTruncated = true;\n+                break;\n+            }\n+            buf = (uint8_t*)malloc(BUFFER_SIZE);\n+            if (buf == NULL) {\n+                return NO_MEMORY;\n+            }\n+            mBuffers.push_back(buf);\n+            mCurrentWritten = 0;\n+        }\n+\n+        int64_t remainingTime = (mStartTime + timeout) - uptimeMillis();\n+        if (remainingTime <= 0) {\n+            mTimedOut = true;\n+            break;\n+        }\n+\n+        int count = poll(&pfds, 1, remainingTime);\n+        if (count == 0) {\n+            mTimedOut = true;\n+            break;\n+        } else if (count < 0) {\n+            return -errno;\n+        } else {\n+            if ((pfds.revents & POLLERR) != 0) {\n+                return errno != 0 ? -errno : UNKNOWN_ERROR;\n+            } else {\n+                ssize_t amt = ::read(fd, buf + mCurrentWritten, BUFFER_SIZE - mCurrentWritten);\n+                if (amt < 0) {\n+                    if (errno == EAGAIN || errno == EWOULDBLOCK) {\n+                        continue;\n+                    } else {\n+                        return -errno;\n+                    }\n+                } else if (amt == 0) {\n+                    break;\n+                }\n+                mCurrentWritten += amt;\n+            }\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+    mFinishTime = uptimeMillis();\n+    return NO_ERROR;\n+}\n+\n+size_t\n+FdBuffer::size()\n+{\n+    return ((mBuffers.size() - 1) * BUFFER_SIZE) + mCurrentWritten;\n+}\n+\n+status_t\n+FdBuffer::write(ReportRequestSet* reporter)\n+{\n+    const int N = mBuffers.size() - 1;\n+    for (int i=0; i<N; i++) {\n+        reporter->write(mBuffers[i], BUFFER_SIZE);\n+    }\n+    reporter->write(mBuffers[N], mCurrentWritten);\n+    return NO_ERROR;\n+}\n+\n+"
        },

If this\n+     * happens, truncated() will return true so it can be marked. If the data is\n+     * exactly 4 MB, truncated is still set. Sorry.\n+     */\n+    bool truncated() { return mTruncated; }\n+\n+    /**\n+     * How much data was read.\n+     */\n+    size_t size();\n+\n+    /**\n+     * Write the data that we recorded to the fd given.\n+     */\n+    status_t write(ReportRequestSet* requests);\n+\n+    /**\n+     * How long the read took in milliseconds.\n+     */\n+    int64_t durationMs() { return mFinishTime - mStartTime; }\n+\n+private:\n+    vector<uint8_t*> mBuffers;\n+    int64_t mStartTime;\n+    int64_t mFinishTime;\n+    ssize_t mCurrentWritten;\n+    bool mTimedOut;\n+    bool mTruncated;\n+};\n+\n+\n+#endif // FD_BUFFER_H"

this file except in compliance with the License.\n+ * You may obtain a copy of the License at\n+ *\n+ *      http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0\n+ *\n+ * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software\n+ * distributed under the License is distributed on an \"AS IS\" BASIS,\n+ * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.\n+ * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and\n+ * limitations under the License.\n+ */\n+\n+#define LOG_TAG \"incidentd\"\n+\n+#include \"IncidentService.h\"\n+\n+#include \"Reporter.h\"\n+\n+#include <binder/IPCThreadState.h>\n+#include <binder/IServiceManager.h>\n+#include <cutils/log.h>\n+#include <private/android_filesystem_config.h>\n+#include <utils/Looper.h>\n+\n+#include <unistd.h>\n+\n+using namespace android;\n+\n+enum {\n+    WHAT_RUN_REPORT = 1,\n+    WHAT_SEND_BACKLOG_TO_DROPBOX = 2\n+};\n+\n+//#define DEFAULT_BACKLOG_DELAY_NS (1000000000LL * 60 * 5)\n+#define DEFAULT_BACKLOG_DELAY_NS (1000000000LL)\n+\n+// ================================================================================\n+String16 const DUMP_PERMISSION(\"android.permission.DUMP\");\n+String16 const USAGE_STATS_PERMISSION(\"android.permission.PACKAGE_USAGE_STATS\");\n+\n+static Status\n+checkIncidentPermissions()\n+{\n+    if (!checkCallingPermission(DUMP_PERMISSION)) {\n+        ALOGW(\"Calling pid %d and uid %d does not have permission: android.permission.DUMP\",\n+                IPCThreadState::self()->getCallingPid(), IPCThreadState::self()->getCallingUid());\n+        return Status::fromExceptionCode(Status::EX_SECURITY,\n+                \"Calling process does not have permission: android.permission.DUMP\");\n+    }\n+    if (!checkCallingPermission(USAGE_STATS_PERMISSION)) {\n+        ALOGW(\"Calling pid %d and uid %d does not have permission: android.permission.USAGE_STATS\",\n+                IPCThreadState::self()->getCallingPid(), IPCThreadState::self()->getCallingUid());\n+        return Status::fromExceptionCode(Status::EX_SECURITY,\n+                \"Calling process does not have permission: android.permission.USAGE_STATS\");\n+    }\n+    return Status::ok();\n+}\n+\n+\n+// ================================================================================\n+ReportRequestQueue::ReportRequestQueue()\n+{\n+}\n+\n+ReportRequestQueue::~ReportRequestQueue()\n+{\n+}\n+\n+void\n+ReportRequestQueue::addRequest(const sp<ReportRequest>& request) \n+{\n+    unique_lock<mutex> lock(mLock);\n+    mQueue.push_back(request);\n+}\n+\n+sp<ReportRequest>\n+ReportRequestQueue::getNextRequest()\n+{\n+    unique_lock<mutex> lock(mLock);\n+    if (mQueue.empty()) {\n+        return NULL;\n+    } else {\n+        sp<ReportRequest> front(mQueue.front());\n+        mQueue.pop_front();\n+        return front;\n+    }\n+}\n+\n+\n+// ================================================================================\n+ReportHandler::ReportHandler(const sp<Looper>& handlerLooper, const sp<ReportRequestQueue>& queue)\n+    :mBacklogDelay(DEFAULT_BACKLOG_DELAY_NS),\n+     mHandlerLooper(handlerLooper),\n+     mQueue(queue)\n+{\n+}\n+\n+ReportHandler::~ReportHandler()\n+{\n+}\n+\n+void\n+ReportHandler::handleMessage(const Message& message)\n+{\n+    switch (message.what) {\n+        case WHAT_RUN_REPORT:\n+            run_report();\n+            break;\n+        case WHAT_SEND_BACKLOG_TO_DROPBOX:\n+            send_backlog_to_dropbox();\n+            break;\n+    }\n+}\n+\n+void\n+ReportHandler::scheduleRunReport(const sp<ReportRequest>& request)\n+{\n+    mQueue->addRequest(request);\n+    mHandlerLooper->removeMessages(this, WHAT_RUN_REPORT);\n+    mHandlerLooper->sendMessage(this, Message(WHAT_RUN_REPORT));\n+}\n+\n+void\n+ReportHandler::scheduleSendBacklogToDropbox()\n+{\n+    unique_lock<mutex> lock(mLock);\n+    mBacklogDelay = DEFAULT_BACKLOG_DELAY_NS;\n+    schedule_send_backlog_to_dropbox_locked();\n+}\n+\n+void\n+ReportHandler::schedule_send_backlog_to_dropbox_locked()\n+{\n+    mHandlerLooper->removeMessages(this, WHAT_SEND_BACKLOG_TO_DROPBOX);\n+    mHandlerLooper->sendMessageDelayed(mBacklogDelay, this,\n+            Message(WHAT_SEND_BACKLOG_TO_DROPBOX));\n+}\n+\n+void\n+ReportHandler::run_report()\n+{\n+    sp<Reporter> reporter = new Reporter();\n+\n+    // Merge all of the requests into one that has all of the\n+    // requested fields.\n+    while (true) {\n+        sp<ReportRequest> request = mQueue->getNextRequest();\n+        if (request == NULL) {\n+            break;\n+        }\n+        reporter->batch.add(request);\n+        reporter->args.merge(request->args);\n+    }\n+\n+    // Take the report, which might take a while. More requests might queue\n+    // up while we're doing this, and we'll handle them in their next batch.\n+    // TODO: We should further rate-limit the reports to no more than N per time-period.\n+    Reporter::run_report_status_t reportStatus = reporter->runReport();\n+    if (reportStatus == Reporter::REPORT_NEEDS_DROPBOX) {\n+        unique_lock<mutex> lock(mLock);\n+        schedule_send_backlog_to_dropbox_locked();\n+    }\n+}\n+\n+void\n+ReportHandler::send_backlog_to_dropbox()\n+{\n+    if (Reporter::upload_backlog() == Reporter::REPORT_NEEDS_DROPBOX) {\n+        // There was a failure. Exponential backoff.\n+        unique_lock<mutex> lock(mLock);\n+        mBacklogDelay *= 2;\n+        ALOGI(\"Error sending to dropbox. Trying again in %lld minutes\",\n+                (mBacklogDelay / (1000000000LL * 60)));\n+        schedule_send_backlog_to_dropbox_locked();\n+    } else {\n+        mBacklogDelay = DEFAULT_BACKLOG_DELAY_NS;\n+    }\n+}\n+\n+// ================================================================================\n+IncidentService::IncidentService(const sp<Looper>& handlerLooper)\n+    :mQueue(new ReportRequestQueue())\n+{\n+    mHandler = new ReportHandler(handlerLooper, mQueue);\n+}\n+\n+IncidentService::~IncidentService()\n+{\n+}\n+\n+Status\n+IncidentService::reportIncident(const IncidentReportArgs& args)\n+{\n+    ALOGI(\"reportIncident\");\n+\n+    Status status = checkIncidentPermissions();\n+    if (!status.isOk()) {\n+        return status;\n+    }\n+\n+    mHandler->scheduleRunReport(new ReportRequest(args, NULL, -1));\n+\n+    return Status::ok();\n+}\n+\n+Status\n+IncidentService::reportIncidentToStream(const IncidentReportArgs& args,\n+            const sp<IIncidentReportStatusListener>& listener, const unique_fd& stream)\n+{\n+    ALOGI(\"reportIncidentToStream\");\n+\n+    Status status = checkIncidentPermissions();\n+    if (!status.isOk()) {\n+        return status;\n+    }\n+\n+    int fd = dup(stream.get());\n+    if (fd < 0) {\n+        return Status::fromStatusT(-errno);\n+    }\n+\n+    mHandler->scheduleRunReport(new ReportRequest(args, listener, fd));\n+\n+    return Status::ok();\n+}\n+\n+Status\n+IncidentService::systemRunning()\n+{\n+    if (IPCThreadState::self()->getCallingUid() != AID_SYSTEM) {\n+        return Status::fromExceptionCode(Status::EX_SECURITY,\n+                \"Only system uid can call systemRunning\");\n+    }\n+    \n+    // When system_server is up and running, schedule the dropbox task to run.\n+    mHandler->scheduleSendBacklogToDropbox();\n+\n+    return Status::ok();\n+}\n+"

the reports that have been queued.\n+     */\n+    void run_report();\n+\n+    /**\n+     * Schedules a dropbox task mBacklogDelay nanoseconds from now.\n+     */\n+    void schedule_send_backlog_to_dropbox_locked();\n+\n+    /**\n+     * Sends the backlog to the dropbox service.\n+     */\n+    void send_backlog_to_dropbox();\n+};\n+\n+\n+// ================================================================================\n+class IncidentService : public BnIncidentManager {\n+public:\n+    IncidentService(const sp<Looper>& handlerLooper);\n+    virtual ~IncidentService();\n+\n+    virtual Status reportIncident(const IncidentReportArgs& args);\n+\n+    virtual Status reportIncidentToStream(const IncidentReportArgs&             "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,352 @@\n+/*\n+ * Copyright (C) 2016 The Android Open Source Project\n+ *\n+ * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the \"License\");\n+ * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.\n+ * You may obtain a copy of the License at\n+ *\n+ *      http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0\n+ *\n+ * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software\n+ * distributed under the License is distributed on an \"AS IS\" BASIS,\n+ * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.\n+ * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and\n+ * limitations under the License.\n+ */\n+\n+#define LOG_TAG \"incidentd\"\n+\n+#include \"Reporter.h\"\n+#include \"protobuf.h\"\n+\n+#include \"report_directory.h\"\n+#include \"section_list.h\"\n+\n+#include <private/android_filesystem_config.h>\n+#include <android/os/DropBoxManager.h>\n+#include <utils/SystemClock.h>\n+\n+#include <sys/types.h>\n+#include <sys/stat.h>\n+#include <dirent.h>\n+#include <fcntl.h>\n+#include <errno.h>\n+\n+/**\n+ * The directory where the incident reports are stored.\n+ */\n+static const String8 INCIDENT_DIRECTORY(\"/data/incidents\");\n+\n+static status_t\n+write_all(int fd, uint8_t const* buf, size_t size)\n+{\n+    while (size > 0) {\n+        ssize_t amt = ::write(fd, buf, size);\n+        if (amt < 0) {\n+            return -errno;\n+        }\n+        size -= amt;\n+        buf += amt;\n+    }\n+    return NO_ERROR;\n+}\n+\n+// ================================================================================\n+ReportRequest::ReportRequest(const IncidentReportArgs& a,\n+            const sp<IIncidentReportStatusListener> &l, int f)\n+    :args(a),\n+     listener(l),\n+     fd(f),\n+     err(NO_ERROR)\n+{\n+}\n+\n+ReportRequest::~ReportRequest()\n+{\n+}\n+\n+// ================================================================================\n+ReportRequestSet::ReportRequestSet()\n+    :mRequests(),\n+     mWritableCount(0),\n+     mMainFd(-1)\n+{\n+}\n+\n+ReportRequestSet::~ReportRequestSet()\n+{\n+}\n+\n+void\n+ReportRequestSet::add(const sp<ReportRequest>& request)\n+{\n+    mRequests.push_back(request);\n+    mWritableCount++;\n+}\n+\n+void\n+ReportRequestSet::setMainFd(int fd)\n+{\n+    mMainFd = fd;\n+    mWritableCount++;\n+}\n+\n+status_t\n+ReportRequestSet::write(uint8_t const* buf, size_t size)\n+{\n+    status_t err = EBADF;\n+\n+    // The streaming ones\n+    int const N = mRequests.size();\n+    for (int i=N-1; i>=0; i--) {\n+        sp<ReportRequest> request = mRequests[i];\n+        if (request->fd >= 0 && request->err == NO_ERROR) {\n+            err = write_all(request->fd, buf, size);\n+            if (err != NO_ERROR) {\n+                request->err = err;\n+                mWritableCount--;\n+            }\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+    // The dropbox file\n+    if (mMainFd >= 0) {\n+        err = write_all(mMainFd, buf, size);\n+        if (err != NO_ERROR) {\n+            mMainFd = -1;\n+            mWritableCount--;\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+    // Return an error only when there are no FDs to write.\n+    return mWritableCount > 0 ? NO_ERROR : err;\n+}\n+\n+\n+// ================================================================================\n+Reporter::Reporter()\n+    :args(),\n+     batch()\n+{\n+    char buf[100];\n+\n+    // TODO: Make the max size smaller for user builds.\n+    mMaxSize = 100 * 1024 * 1024;\n+    mMaxCount = 100;\n+\n+    // There can't be two at the same time because it's on one thread.\n+    mStartTime = time(NULL);\n+    strftime(buf, sizeof(buf), \"/incident-%Y%m%d-%H%M%S\", localtime(&mStartTime));\n+    mFilename = INCIDENT_DIRECTORY + buf;\n+}\n+\n+Reporter::~Reporter()\n+{\n+}\n+\n+Reporter::run_report_status_t\n+Reporter::runReport()\n+{\n+\n+    status_t err = NO_ERROR;\n+    bool needMainFd = false;\n+    int mainFd = -1;\n+\n+    // See if we need the main file\n+    for (ReportRequestSet::iterator it=batch.begin(); it!=batch.end(); it++) {\n+        if ((*it)->fd < 0 && mainFd < 0) {\n+            needMainFd = true;\n+            break;\n+        }\n+    }\n+    if (needMainFd) {\n+        // Create the directory\n+        err = create_directory(INCIDENT_DIRECTORY);\n+        if (err != NO_ERROR) {\n+            goto done;\n+        }\n+\n+        // If there are too many files in the directory (for whatever reason),\n+        // delete the oldest ones until it's under the limit. Doing this first\n+        // does mean that we can go over, so the max size is not a hard limit.\n+        clean_directory(INCIDENT_DIRECTORY, mMaxSize, mMaxCount);\n+\n+        // Open the file.\n+        err = create_file(&mainFd);\n+        if (err != NO_ERROR) {\n+            goto done;\n+        }\n+\n+        // Add to the set\n+        batch.setMainFd(mainFd);\n+    }\n+\n+    // Tell everyone that we're starting.\n+    for (ReportRequestSet::iterator it=batch.begin(); it!=batch.end(); it++) {\n+        if ((*it)->listener != NULL) {\n+            (*it)->listener->onReportStarted();\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+    // Write the incident headers\n+    for (ReportRequestSet::iterator it=batch.begin(); it!=batch.end(); it++) {\n+        const sp<ReportRequest> request = (*it);\n+        const vector<vector<int8_t>>& headers = request->args.headers();\n+\n+        for (vector<vector<int8_t>>::const_iterator buf=headers.begin(); buf!=headers.end();\n+                buf++) {\n+            int fd = request->fd >= 0 ? request->fd : mainFd;\n+\n+            uint8_t buffer[20];\n+            uint8_t* p = write_length_delimited_tag_header(buffer, FIELD_ID_INCIDENT_HEADER,\n+                    buf->size());\n+            write_all(fd, buffer, p-buffer);\n+\n+            write_all(fd, (uint8_t const*)buf->data(), buf->size());\n+            // If there was an error now, there will be an error later and we will remove\n+            // it from the list then.\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+    // For each of the report fields, see if we need it, and if so, execute the command\n+    // and report to those that care that we're doing it.\n+    for (const Section** section=SECTION_LIST; *section; section++) {\n+        const int id = (*section)->id;\n+        ALOGD(\"Taking incident report section %d '%s'\", id, (*section)->name.string());\n+\n+        if (this->args.containsSection(id)) {\n+            // Notify listener of starting\n+            for (ReportRequestSet::iterator it=batch.begin(); it!=batch.end(); it++) {\n+                if ((*it)->listener != NULL && (*it)->args.containsSection(id)) {\n+                    (*it)->listener->onReportSectionStatus(id,\n+                            IIncidentReportStatusListener::STATUS_STARTING);\n+                }\n+            }\n+\n+            // Execute - go get the data and write it into the file descriptors.\n+            err = (*section)->Execute(&batch);\n+            if (err != NO_ERROR) {\n+                ALOGW(\"Incident section %s (%d) failed. Stopping report.\",\n+                        (*section)->name.string(), id);\n+                goto done;\n+            }\n+\n+            // Notify listener of starting\n+            for (ReportRequestSet::iterator it=batch.begin(); it!=batch.end(); it++) {\n+                if ((*it)->listener != NULL && (*it)->args.containsSection(id)) {\n+                    (*it)->listener->onReportSectionStatus(id,\n+                            IIncidentReportStatusListener::STATUS_FINISHED);\n+                }\n+            }\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+done:\n+    // Close the file.\n+    if (mainFd >= 0) {\n+        close(mainFd);\n+    }\n+\n+    // Tell everyone that we're done.\n+    for (ReportRequestSet::iterator it=batch.begin(); it!=batch.end(); it++) {\n+        if ((*it)->listener != NULL) {\n+            if (err == NO_ERROR) {\n+                (*it)->listener->onReportFinished();\n+            } else {\n+                (*it)->listener->onReportFailed();\n+            }\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+    // Put the report into dropbox.\n+    if (needMainFd && err == NO_ERROR) {\n+        sp<DropBoxManager> dropbox = new DropBoxManager();\n+        Status status = dropbox->addFile(String16(\"incident\"), mFilename, 0);\n+        ALOGD(\"Incident report done. dropbox status=%s\\n\", status.toString8().string());\n+        if (!status.isOk()) {\n+            return REPORT_NEEDS_DROPBOX;\n+        }\n+\n+        // If the status was ok, delete the file. If not, leave it around until the next\n+        // boot or the next checkin. If the directory gets too big older files will\n+        // be rotated out.\n+        unlink(mFilename.c_str());\n+    }\n+\n+    return REPORT_FINISHED;\n+}\n+\n+/**\n+ * Create our output file and set the access permissions to -rw-rw----\n+ */\n+status_t\n+Reporter::create_file(int* fd)\n+{\n+    const char* filename = mFilename.c_str();\n+\n+    *fd = open(filename, O_CREAT | O_TRUNC | O_RDWR, 0660);\n+    if (*fd < 0) {\n+        ALOGE(\"Couldn't open incident file: %s (%s)\", filename, strerror(errno));\n+        return -errno;\n+    }\n+\n+    // Override umask. Not super critical. If it fails go on with life.\n+    chmod(filename, 0660);\n+\n+    if (chown(filename, AID_SYSTEM, AID_SYSTEM)) {\n+        ALOGE(\"Unable to change ownership of incident file %s: %s\\n\", filename, strerror(errno));\n+        status_t err = -errno;\n+        unlink(mFilename.c_str());\n+        return err;\n+    }\n+\n+    return NO_ERROR;\n+}\n+\n+// ================================================================================\n+Reporter::run_report_status_t\n+Reporter::upload_backlog()\n+{\n+    DIR* dir;\n+    struct dirent* entry;\n+    struct stat st;\n+\n+    if ((dir = opendir(INCIDENT_DIRECTORY.string())) == NULL) {\n+        ALOGE(\"Couldn't open incident directory: %s\", INCIDENT_DIRECTORY.string());\n+        return REPORT_NEEDS_DROPBOX;\n+    }\n+\n+    String8 dirbase(INCIDENT_DIRECTORY + \"/\");\n+    sp<DropBoxManager> dropbox = new DropBoxManager();\n+\n+    // Enumerate, count and add up size\n+    while ((entry = readdir(dir)) != NULL) {\n+        if (entry->d_name[0] == '.') {\n+            continue;\n+        }\n+        String8 filename = dirbase + entry->d_name;\n+        if (stat(filename.string(), &st) != 0) {\n+            ALOGE(\"Unable to stat file %s\", filename.string());\n+            continue;\n+        }\n+        if (!S_ISREG(st.st_mode)) {\n+            continue;\n+        }\n+\n+        Status status = dropbox->addFile(String16(\"incident\"), filename.string(), 0);\n+        ALOGD(\"Incident report done. dropbox status=%s\\n\", status.toString8().string());\n+        if (!status.isOk()) {\n+            return REPORT_NEEDS_DROPBOX;\n+        }\n+\n+        // If the status was ok, delete the file. If not, leave it around until the next\n+        // boot or the next checkin. If the directory gets too big older files will\n+        // be rotated out.\n+        unlink(filename.string());\n+    }\n+\n+    closedir(dir);\n+\n+    return REPORT_FINISHED;\n+}\n+"

If a write fails, it stops\n+    // writing to that fd and returns NO_ERROR. When we are out of fds to write\n+    // to it returns an error.\n+    status_t write(uint8_t const* buf, size_t size);\n+\n+    typedef vector<sp<ReportRequest>>::iterator iterator;\n+\n+    iterator begin() { return mRequests.begin(); }\n+    iterator end() { return mRequests.end(); }\n+\n+private:\n+    vector<sp<ReportRequest>> mRequests;\n+    int mWritableCount;\n+    int mMainFd;\n+};\n+\n+// ================================================================================\n+class Reporter : public virtual RefBase\n+{\n+public:\n+    enum run_report_status_t {\n+        REPORT_FINISHED = 0,\n+        REPORT_NEEDS_DROPBOX = 1\n+    };\n+\n+    IncidentReportArgs args;\n+    ReportRequestSet batch;\n+\n+    Reporter();\n+    virtual ~Reporter();\n+\n+    // Run the report as described in the batch and args parameters.\n+    run_report_status_t runReport();\n+\n+    static run_report_status_t upload_backlog();\n+\n+private:\n+    string mFilename;\n+    off_t mMaxSize;\n+    size_t mMaxCount;\n+    time_t mStartTime;\n+\n+    status_t create_file(int* fd);\n+};\n+\n+\n+#endif // REPORTER_H"
