            "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,292 @@\n+/*\n+ * Copyright (C) 2016 The Android Open Source Project\n+ *\n+ * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the \"License\");\n+ * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.\n+ * You may obtain a copy of the License at\n+ *\n+ *      http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0\n+ *\n+ * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software\n+ * distributed under the License is distributed on an \"AS IS\" BASIS,\n+ * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.\n+ * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and\n+ * limitations under the License.\n+ */\n+\n+#define LOG_TAG \"incidentd\"\n+\n+#include \"Section.h\"\n+#include \"protobuf.h\"\n+\n+#include <binder/IServiceManager.h>\n+#include <mutex>\n+\n+using namespace std;\n+\n+const int64_t REMOTE_CALL_TIMEOUT_MS = 10 * 1000; // 10 seconds\n+\n+// ================================================================================\n+Section::Section(int i)\n+    :id(i)\n+{\n+}\n+\n+Section::~Section()\n+{\n+}\n+\n+status_t\n+Section::WriteHeader(ReportRequestSet* requests, size_t size) const\n+{\n+    ssize_t amt;\n+    uint8_t buf[20];\n+    uint8_t* p = write_length_delimited_tag_header(buf, this->id, size);\n+    return requests->write(buf, p-buf);\n+}\n+\n+// ================================================================================\n+struct WorkerThreadData : public virtual RefBase\n+{\n+    const WorkerThreadSection* section;\n+    int fds[2];\n+\n+    // Lock protects these fields\n+    mutex lock;\n+    bool workerDone;\n+    status_t workerError;\n+\n+    WorkerThreadData(const WorkerThreadSection* section);\n+    virtual ~WorkerThreadData();\n+\n+    int readFd() { return fds[0]; }\n+    int writeFd() { return fds[1]; }\n+};\n+\n+WorkerThreadData::WorkerThreadData(const WorkerThreadSection* sec)\n+    :section(sec),\n+     workerDone(false),\n+     workerError(NO_ERROR)\n+{\n+    fds[0] = -1;\n+    fds[1] = -1;\n+}\n+\n+WorkerThreadData::~WorkerThreadData()\n+{\n+}\n+\n+// ================================================================================\n+WorkerThreadSection::WorkerThreadSection(int id)\n+    :Section(id)\n+{\n+}\n+\n+WorkerThreadSection::~WorkerThreadSection()\n+{\n+}\n+\n+static void*\n+worker_thread_func(void* cookie)\n+{\n+    WorkerThreadData* data = (WorkerThreadData*)cookie;\n+    status_t err = data->section->BlockingCall(data->writeFd());\n+\n+    {\n+        unique_lock<mutex> lock(data->lock);\n+        data->workerDone = true;\n+        data->workerError = err;\n+    }\n+\n+    close(data->writeFd());\n+    data->decStrong(data->section);\n+    // data might be gone now. don't use it after this point in this thread.\n+    return NULL;\n+}\n+\n+status_t\n+WorkerThreadSection::Execute(ReportRequestSet* requests) const\n+{\n+    status_t err = NO_ERROR;\n+    pthread_t thread;\n+    pthread_attr_t attr;\n+    bool timedOut = false;\n+    FdBuffer buffer;\n+\n+    // Data shared between this thread and the worker thread.\n+    sp<WorkerThreadData> data = new WorkerThreadData(this);\n+\n+    // Create the pipe\n+    err = pipe(data->fds);\n+    if (err != 0) {\n+        return -errno;\n+    }\n+\n+    // The worker thread needs a reference and we can't let the count go to zero\n+    // if that thread is slow to start.\n+    data->incStrong(this);\n+\n+    // Create the thread\n+    err = pthread_attr_init(&attr);\n+    if (err != 0) {\n+        return -err;\n+    }\n+    // TODO: Do we need to tweak thread priority?\n+    err = pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&attr, PTHREAD_CREATE_DETACHED);\n+    if (err != 0) {\n+        pthread_attr_destroy(&attr);\n+        return -err;\n+    }\n+    err = pthread_create(&thread, &attr, worker_thread_func, (void*)data.get());\n+    if (err != 0) {\n+        pthread_attr_destroy(&attr);\n+        return -err;\n+    }\n+    pthread_attr_destroy(&attr);\n+\n+    // Loop reading until either the timeout or the worker side is done (i.e. eof).\n+    err = buffer.read(data->readFd(), REMOTE_CALL_TIMEOUT_MS);\n+    if (err != NO_ERROR) {\n+        // TODO: Log this error into the incident report.\n+        ALOGW(\"WorkerThreadSection '%s' reader failed with error '%s'\", this->name.string(),\n+                strerror(-err));\n+    }\n+\n+    // Done with the read fd. The worker thread closes the write one so\n+    // we never race and get here first.\n+    close(data->readFd());\n+\n+    // If the worker side is finished, then return its error (which may overwrite\n+    // our possible error -- but it's more interesting anyway).  If not, then we timed out.\n+    {\n+        unique_lock<mutex> lock(data->lock);\n+        if (!data->workerDone) {\n+            // We timed out\n+            timedOut = true;\n+        } else {\n+            if (data->workerError != NO_ERROR) {\n+                err = data->workerError;\n+                // TODO: Log this error into the incident report.\n+                ALOGW(\"WorkerThreadSection '%s' worker failed with error '%s'\", this->name.string(),\n+                        strerror(-err));\n+            }\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+    if (timedOut || buffer.timedOut()) {\n+        ALOGW(\"WorkerThreadSection '%s' timed out\", this->name.string());\n+        return NO_ERROR;\n+    }\n+\n+    if (buffer.truncated()) {\n+        // TODO: Log this into the incident report.\n+    }\n+\n+    // TODO: There was an error with the command or buffering. Report that.  For now\n+    // just exit with a log messasge.\n+    if (err != NO_ERROR) {\n+        ALOGW(\"WorkerThreadSection '%s' failed with error '%s'\", this->name.string(),\n+                strerror(-err));\n+        return NO_ERROR;\n+    }\n+\n+    // Write the data that was collected\n+    ALOGD(\"section '%s' wrote %zd bytes in %d ms\", name.string(), buffer.size(),\n+            (int)buffer.durationMs());\n+    WriteHeader(requests, buffer.size());\n+    err = buffer.write(requests);\n+    if (err != NO_ERROR) {\n+        ALOGW(\"WorkerThreadSection '%s' failed writing: '%s'\", this->name.string(), strerror(-err));\n+        return err;\n+    }\n+\n+    return NO_ERROR;\n+}\n+\n+// ================================================================================\n+CommandSection::CommandSection(int id, const char* first, ...)\n+    :Section(id)\n+{\n+    va_list args;\n+    int count = 0;\n+\n+    va_start(args, first);\n+    while (va_arg(args, const char*) != NULL) {\n+        count++;\n+    }\n+    va_end(args);\n+\n+    mCommand = (const char**)malloc(sizeof(const char*) * count);\n+\n+    mCommand[0] = first;\n+    name = first;\n+    name += \" \";\n+    va_start(args, first);\n+    for (int i=0; i<count; i++) {\n+        const char* arg = va_arg(args, const char*); \n+        mCommand[i+1] = arg;\n+        if (arg != NULL) {\n+            name += va_arg(args, const char*);\n+            name += \" \";\n+        }\n+    }\n+    va_end(args);\n+}\n+\n+CommandSection::~CommandSection()\n+{\n+}\n+\n+status_t\n+CommandSection::Execute(ReportRequestSet* /*requests*/) const\n+{\n+    return NO_ERROR;\n+}\n+\n+// ================================================================================\n+DumpsysSection::DumpsysSection(int id, const char* service, ...)\n+    :WorkerThreadSection(id),\n+     mService(service)\n+{\n+    name = \"dumpsys \";\n+    name += service;\n+\n+    va_list args;\n+    va_start(args, service);\n+    while (true) {\n+        const char* arg = va_arg(args, const char*); \n+        if (arg == NULL) {\n+            break;\n+        }\n+        mArgs.add(String16(arg));\n+        name += \" \";\n+        name += arg;\n+    }\n+    va_end(args);\n+}\n+\n+DumpsysSection::~DumpsysSection()\n+{\n+}\n+\n+status_t\n+DumpsysSection::BlockingCall(int pipeWriteFd) const\n+{\n+    // checkService won't wait for the service to show up like getService will.\n+    sp<IBinder> service = defaultServiceManager()->checkService(mService);\n+    \n+    if (service == NULL) {\n+        // Returning an error interrupts the entire incident report, so just\n+        // log the failure.\n+        // TODO: have a meta record inside the report that would log this\n+        // failure inside the report, because the fact that we can't find\n+        // the service is good data in and of itself. This is running in\n+        // another thread so lock that carefully...\n+        ALOGW(\"DumpsysSection: Can't lookup service: %s\", String8(mService).string());\n+        return NO_ERROR;\n+    }\n+\n+    service->dump(pipeWriteFd, mArgs);\n+\n+    return NO_ERROR;\n+}"

<utils/String8.h>\n+#include <utils/String16.h>\n+#include <utils/Vector.h>\n+\n+using namespace android;\n+\n+/**\n+ * Base class for sections\n+ */\n+class Section\n+{\n+public:\n+    int id;\n+    String8 name;\n+\n+    Section(int id);\n+    virtual ~Section();\n+\n+    virtual status_t Execute(ReportRequestSet* requests) const = 0;\n+\n+    status_t WriteHeader(ReportRequestSet* requests, size_t size) const;\n+};\n+\n+/**\n+ * Section that reads in a file.\n+ */\n+class FileSection : public Section\n+{\n+public:\n+    FileSection(int id, const char* filename);\n+    virtual ~FileSection();\n+\n+    virtual status_t Execute(ReportRequestSet* requests) const;\n+\n+private:\n+    const char* mFilename;\n+};\n+\n+/**\n+ * Base class for sections that call a command that might need a timeout.\n+ */\n+class WorkerThreadSection : public Section\n+{\n+public:\n+    WorkerThreadSection(int id);\n+    virtual ~WorkerThreadSection();\n+\n+    virtual status_t Execute(ReportRequestSet* requests) const;\n+\n+    virtual status_t BlockingCall(int pipeWriteFd) const = 0;\n+};\n+\n+/**\n+ * Section that forks and execs a command, and puts stdout as the section.\n+ */\n+class CommandSection : public Section\n+{\n+public:\n+    CommandSection(int id, const char* first, ...);\n+    virtual ~CommandSection();\n+\n+    virtual status_t Execute(ReportRequestSet* requests) const;\n+\n+private:\n+    const char** mCommand;\n+};\n+\n+/**\n+ * Section that calls dumpsys on a system service.\n+ */\n+class DumpsysSection : public WorkerThreadSection\n+{\n+public:\n+    DumpsysSection(int id, const char* service, ...);\n+    virtual ~DumpsysSection();\n+\n+    virtual status_t BlockingCall(int pipeWriteFd) const;\n+\n+private:\n+    String16 mService;\n+    Vector<String16> mArgs;\n+};\n+\n+#endif // SECTIONS_H\n+"

// everything is oneway, let it queue and save ram\n+    ps->startThreadPool();\n+    ps->giveThreadPoolName();\n+    IPCThreadState::self()->disableBackgroundScheduling(true);\n+\n+    // Create the service\n+    android::sp<IncidentService> service = new IncidentService(looper);\n+    if (defaultServiceManager()->addService(String16(\"incident\"), service) != 0) {\n+        ALOGE(\"Failed to add service\");\n+        return -1;\n+    }\n+\n+    // Loop forever -- the reports run on this thread in a handler, and the\n+    // binder calls remain responsive in their pool of one thread.\n+    while (true) {\n+        looper->pollAll(-1 /* timeoutMillis */);\n+    }\n+    ALOGW(\"incidentd escaped from its loop.\");\n+\n+    return 1;\n+}"

            "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,41 @@\n+/*\n+ * Copyright (C) 2016 The Android Open Source Project\n+ *\n+ * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the \"License\");\n+ * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.\n+ * You may obtain a copy of the License at\n+ *\n+ *      http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0\n+ *\n+ * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software\n+ * distributed under the License is distributed on an \"AS IS\" BASIS,\n+ * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.\n+ * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and\n+ * limitations under the License.\n+ */\n+\n+#include \"protobuf.h\"\n+\n+uint8_t*\n+write_raw_varint(uint8_t* buf, uint32_t val)\n+{\n+    uint8_t* p = buf;\n+    while (true) {\n+        if ((val & ~0x7F) == 0) {\n+            *p++ = (uint8_t)val;\n+            return p;\n+        } else {\n+            *p++ = (uint8_t)((val & 0x7F) | 0x80);\n+            val >>= 7;\n+        }\n+    }\n+}\n+\n+uint8_t*\n+write_length_delimited_tag_header(uint8_t* buf, uint32_t fieldId, size_t size)\n+{\n+    buf = write_raw_varint(buf, (fieldId << 3) | 2);\n+    buf = write_raw_varint(buf, size);\n+    return buf;\n+}\n+"

Return the next position to write at.\n+ * There must be 10 bytes in the buffer. The same as EncodedBuffer.writeRawVarint32\n+ */\n+uint8_t* write_raw_varint(uint8_t* buf, uint32_t val);\n+\n+/**\n+ * Write a protobuf WIRE_TYPE_LENGTH_DELIMITED header. Return the next position to write at.\n+ * There must be 20 bytes in the buffer.\n+ */\n+uint8_t* write_length_delimited_tag_header(uint8_t* buf, uint32_t fieldId, size_t size);\n+\n+enum {\n+    // IncidentProto.header\n+    FIELD_ID_INCIDENT_HEADER = 1\n+};\n+\n+#endif // PROTOBUF_H\n+"

            "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,173 @@\n+/*\n+ * Copyright (C) 2016 The Android Open Source Project\n+ *\n+ * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the \"License\");\n+ * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.\n+ * You may obtain a copy of the License at\n+ *\n+ *      http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0\n+ *\n+ * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software\n+ * distributed under the License is distributed on an \"AS IS\" BASIS,\n+ * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.\n+ * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and\n+ * limitations under the License.\n+ */\n+\n+#define LOG_TAG \"incidentd\"\n+\n+#include \"report_directory.h\"\n+\n+#include <cutils/log.h>\n+#include <private/android_filesystem_config.h>\n+#include <utils/String8.h>\n+\n+#include <sys/types.h>\n+#include <sys/stat.h>\n+#include <dirent.h>\n+#include <libgen.h>\n+#include <unistd.h>\n+\n+#include <vector>\n+\n+using namespace android;\n+using namespace std;\n+\n+status_t\n+create_directory(const char* directory)\n+{\n+    struct stat st;\n+    status_t err = NO_ERROR;\n+    char* dir = strdup(directory);\n+\n+    // Skip first slash\n+    char* d = dir + 1;\n+\n+    // Create directories, assigning them to the system user\n+    bool last = false;\n+    while (!last) {\n+        d = strchr(d, '/');\n+        if (d != NULL) {\n+            *d = '\\0';\n+        } else {\n+            last = true;\n+        }\n+        if (stat(dir, &st) == 0) {\n+            if (!S_ISDIR(st.st_mode)) {\n+                err = ALREADY_EXISTS;\n+                goto done;\n+            }\n+        } else {\n+            if (mkdir(dir, 0770)) {\n+                ALOGE(\"No incident reports today. \"\n+                        \"Unable to create incident report dir %s: %s\", dir,\n+                        strerror(errno));\n+                err = -errno;\n+                goto done;\n+            }\n+            if (chmod(dir, 0770)) {\n+                ALOGE(\"No incident reports today. \"\n+                        \"Unable to set permissions for incident report dir %s: %s\", dir,\n+                        strerror(errno));\n+                err = -errno;\n+                goto done;\n+            }\n+            if (chown(dir, AID_SYSTEM, AID_SYSTEM)) {\n+                ALOGE(\"No incident reports today. Unable to change ownership of dir %s: %s\\n\",\n+                        dir, strerror(errno));\n+                err = -errno;\n+                goto done;\n+            }\n+        }\n+        if (!last) {\n+            *d++ = '/';\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+    // Ensure that the final directory is owned by the system with 0770. If it isn't\n+    // we won't write into it.\n+    if (stat(directory, &st) != 0) {\n+        ALOGE(\"No incident reports today. Can't stat: %s\", directory);\n+        err = -errno;\n+        goto done;\n+    }\n+    if ((st.st_mode & 0777) != 0770) {\n+        ALOGE(\"No incident reports today. Mode is %0o on report directory %s\",\n+                st.st_mode, directory);\n+        err = BAD_VALUE;\n+        goto done;\n+    }\n+    if (st.st_uid != AID_SYSTEM || st.st_gid != AID_SYSTEM) {\n+        ALOGE(\"No incident reports today. Owner is %d and group is %d on report directory %s\",\n+                st.st_uid, st.st_gid, directory);\n+        err = BAD_VALUE;\n+        goto done;\n+    }\n+\n+done:\n+    free(dir);\n+    return err;\n+}\n+\n+static bool\n+stat_mtime_cmp(const pair<String8,struct stat>& a, const pair<String8,struct stat>& b)\n+{\n+    return a.second.st_mtime < b.second.st_mtime;\n+}\n+\n+void\n+clean_directory(const char* directory, off_t maxSize, size_t maxCount)\n+{\n+    DIR* dir;\n+    struct dirent* entry;\n+    struct stat st;\n+\n+    vector<pair<String8,struct stat>> files;\n+\n+    if ((dir = opendir(directory)) == NULL) {\n+        ALOGE(\"Couldn't open incident directory: %s\", directory);\n+        return;\n+    }\n+\n+    String8 dirbase(String8(directory) + \"/\");\n+\n+    off_t totalSize = 0;\n+    size_t totalCount = 0;\n+\n+    // Enumerate, count and add up size\n+    while ((entry = readdir(dir)) != NULL) {\n+        if (entry->d_name[0] == '.') {\n+            continue;\n+        }\n+        String8 filename = dirbase + entry->d_name;\n+        if (stat(filename.string(), &st) != 0) {\n+            ALOGE(\"Unable to stat file %s\", filename.string());\n+            continue;\n+        }\n+        if (!S_ISREG(st.st_mode)) {\n+            continue;\n+        }\n+        files.push_back(pair<String8,struct stat>(filename, st));\n+\n+        totalSize += st.st_size;\n+        totalCount++;\n+    }\n+\n+    closedir(dir);\n+\n+    // Count or size is less than max, then we're done.\n+    if (totalSize < maxSize && totalCount < maxCount) {\n+        return;\n+    }\n+\n+    // Oldest files first.\n+    sort(files.begin(), files.end(), stat_mtime_cmp);\n+\n+    // Remove files until we're under our limits.\n+    for (vector<pair<String8,struct stat>>::iterator it = files.begin();\n+            it != files.end() && totalSize >= maxSize && totalCount >= maxCount; it++) {\n+        remove(it->first.string());\n+        totalSize -= it->second.st_size;\n+        totalCount--;\n+    }\n+}"
        },

          int dragDuration) {\n+        if (dragDuration < 0) {\n+            dragDuration = 300;\n+        }\n+        long now = SystemClock.uptimeMillis();\n+        injectMotionEvent(inputSource, MotionEvent.ACTION_DOWN, now, x1, y1, 1.0f);\n+        try {\n+            Thread.sleep(ViewConfiguration.getLongPressTimeout());\n+        } catch (InterruptedException e) {\n+            throw new RuntimeException(e);\n+        }\n+        now = SystemClock.uptimeMillis();\n+        long startTime = now;\n+        long endTime = startTime + dragDuration;\n+        while (now < endTime) {\n+            long elapsedTime = now - startTime;\n+            float alpha = (float) elapsedTime / dragDuration;\n+            injectMotionEvent(inputSource, MotionEvent.ACTION_MOVE, now, lerp(x1, x2, alpha),\n+                    lerp(y1, y2, alpha), 1.0f);\n+            now = SystemClock.uptimeMillis();\n+        }\n+        injectMotionEvent(inputSource, MotionEvent.ACTION_UP, now, x2, y2, 0.0f);\n+    }\n+\n     /**\n      * Sends a simple zero-pressure move event.\n      *\n@@ -294,6 +333,8 @@ private void showUsage() {\n         System.err.println(\"      tap <x> <y> (Default: Example: 1234\\n\" +\n+            \"\\n\" +\n+            \"locksettings set-pin: sets a PIN\\n\" +\n+            \"\\n\" +\n+            \"locksettings set-password: sets a password\\n\" +\n+            \"\\n\" +\n+            \"locksettings clear: clears the unlock credential\\n\";\n+\n+    public static void main(String[] args) {\n+        (new LockSettingsCmd()).run(args);\n+    }\n+\n+    @Override\n+    public void onShowUsage(PrintStream out) {\n+        out.println(USAGE);\n+    }\n+\n+    @Override\n+    public void onRun() throws Exception {\n+        ILockSettings lockSettings = ILockSettings.Stub.asInterface(\n+                ServiceManager.getService(\"lock_settings\"));\n+        lockSettings.asBinder().shellCommand(FileDescriptor.in, FileDescriptor.out,\n+                FileDescriptor.err, getRawArgs(), new ShellCallback(), new ResultReceiver(null) {});\n+    }\n+}"

            "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,185 @@\n+/*\n+**\n+** Copyright 2016, The Android Open Source Project\n+**\n+** Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the \"License\");\n+** you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.\n+** You may obtain a copy of the License at\n+**\n+**     http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0\n+**\n+** Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software\n+** distributed under the License is distributed on an \"AS IS\" BASIS,\n+** WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.\n+** See the License for the specific language governing permissions and\n+** limitations under the License.\n+*/\n+\n+package com.android.commands.media;\n+\n+import android.content.Context;\n+import android.media.AudioManager;\n+import android.media.AudioSystem;\n+import android.media.IAudioService;\n+import android.os.ServiceManager;\n+import android.util.AndroidException;\n+\n+import com.android.internal.os.BaseCommand;\n+\n+import java.io.BufferedReader;\n+import java.io.IOException;\n+import java.io.InputStreamReader;\n+import java.io.PrintStream;\n+import java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException;\n+\n+/**\n+ * Command line tool to exercise AudioService.setStreamVolume()\n+ *                           and AudioService.adjustStreamVolume()\n+ */\n+public class VolumeCtrl {\n+\n+    private final static String TAG = \"VolumeCtrl\";\n+\n+    // --stream affects --set, --adj or --get options.\n+    // --show affects --set and --adj options.\n+    // --get can be used with --set, --adj or by itself.\n+    public final static String USAGE = new String(\n+            \"the options are as follows: \\n\" +\n+            \"\\t\\t--stream STREAM selects the stream to control, see AudioManager.STREAM_*\\n\" +\n+            \"\\t\\t                controls AudioManager.STREAM_MUSIC if no stream is specified\\n\"+\n+            \"\\t\\t--set INDEX     sets the volume index value\\n\" +\n+            \"\\t\\t--adj DIRECTION adjusts the volume, use raise|same|lower for the direction\\n\" +\n+            \"\\t\\t--get           outputs the current volume\\n\" +\n+            \"\\t\\t--show          shows the UI during the volume change\\n\" +\n+            \"\\texamples:\\n\" +\n+            \"\\t\\tadb shell media volume --show --stream 3 --set 11\\n\" +\n+            \"\\t\\tadb shell media volume --stream 0 --adj lower\\n\" +\n+            \"\\t\\tadb shell media volume --stream 3 --get\\n\"\n+            );\n+\n+    private final static int VOLUME_CONTROL_MODE_SET = 1;\n+    private final static int VOLUME_CONTROL_MODE_ADJUST = 2;\n+\n+    private final static String ADJUST_LOWER = \"lower\";\n+    private final static String ADJUST_SAME = \"same\";\n+    private final static String ADJUST_RAISE = \"raise\";\n+\n+    public static void run(BaseCommand cmd) throws Exception {\n+        //----------------------------------------\n+        // Default parameters\n+        int stream = AudioManager.STREAM_MUSIC;\n+        int volIndex = 5;\n+        int mode = 0;\n+        int adjDir = AudioManager.ADJUST_RAISE;\n+        boolean showUi = false;\n+        boolean doGet = false;\n+\n+        //----------------------------------------\n+        // read options\n+        String option;\n+        String adjustment = null;\n+        while ((option = cmd.nextOption()) != null) {\n+            switch (option) {\n+                case \"--show\":\n+                    showUi = true;\n+                    break;\n+                case \"--get\":\n+                    doGet = true;\n+                    log(LOG_V, \"will get volume\");\n+                    break;\n+                case \"--stream\":\n+                    stream = Integer.decode(cmd.nextArgRequired()).intValue();\n+                    log(LOG_V, \"will control stream=\" + stream + \" (\" + streamName(stream) + \")\");\n+                    break;\n+                case \"--set\":\n+                    volIndex = Integer.decode(cmd.nextArgRequired()).intValue();\n+                    mode = VOLUME_CONTROL_MODE_SET;\n+                    log(LOG_V, \"will set volume to index=\" + volIndex);\n+                    break;\n+                case \"--adj\":\n+                    mode = VOLUME_CONTROL_MODE_ADJUST;\n+                    adjustment = cmd.nextArgRequired();\n+                    log(LOG_V, \"will adjust volume\");\n+                    break;\n+                default:\n+                    throw new IllegalArgumentException(\"Unknown argument \" + option);\n+            }\n+        }\n+\n+        //------------------------------\n+        // Read options: validation\n+        if (mode == VOLUME_CONTROL_MODE_ADJUST) {\n+            if (adjustment == null) {\n+                cmd.showError(\"Error: no valid volume adjustment (null)\");\n+                return;\n+            }\n+            switch (adjustment) {\n+                case ADJUST_RAISE: adjDir = AudioManager.ADJUST_RAISE; break;\n+                case ADJUST_SAME: adjDir = AudioManager.ADJUST_SAME; break;\n+                case ADJUST_LOWER: adjDir = AudioManager.ADJUST_LOWER; break;\n+                default:\n+                    cmd.showError(\"Error: no valid volume adjustment, was \" + adjustment\n+                            + \", expected \" + ADJUST_LOWER + \"|\" + ADJUST_SAME + \"|\"\n+                            + ADJUST_RAISE);\n+                    return;\n+            }\n+        }\n+\n+        //----------------------------------------\n+        // Test initialization\n+        log(LOG_V, \"Connecting to AudioService\");\n+        IAudioService audioService = IAudioService.Stub.asInterface(ServiceManager.checkService(\n+                Context.AUDIO_SERVICE));\n+        if (audioService == null) {\n+            System.err.println(BaseCommand.NO_SYSTEM_ERROR_CODE);\n+            throw new AndroidException(\n+                    \"Can't connect to audio service; is the system running?\");\n+        }\n+\n+        if (mode == VOLUME_CONTROL_MODE_SET) {\n+            if ((volIndex > audioService.getStreamMaxVolume(stream))\n+                    || (volIndex < audioService.getStreamMinVolume(stream))) {\n+                cmd.showError(String.format(\"Error: invalid volume index %d for stream %d \"\n+                        + \"(should be in [%d..%d])\", volIndex, stream,\n+                        audioService.getStreamMinVolume(stream),\n+                        audioService.getStreamMaxVolume(stream)));\n+                return;\n+            }\n+        }\n+\n+        //----------------------------------------\n+        // Non-interactive test\n+        final int flag = showUi? AudioManager.FLAG_SHOW_UI : 0;\n+        final String pack = cmd.getClass().getPackage().getName();\n+        if (mode == VOLUME_CONTROL_MODE_SET) {\n+            audioService.setStreamVolume(stream, volIndex, flag, pack/*callingPackage*/);\n+        } else if (mode == VOLUME_CONTROL_MODE_ADJUST) {\n+            audioService.adjustStreamVolume(stream, adjDir, flag, pack);\n+        }\n+        if (doGet) {\n+            log(LOG_V, \"volume is \" + audioService.getStreamVolume(stream) +\n+                       \" in range [\" + audioService.getStreamMinVolume(stream) +\n+                       \"..\" + audioService.getStreamMaxVolume(stream) + \"]\");\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+    //--------------------------------------------\n+    // Utilities\n+\n+    static final String LOG_V = \"[v]\";\n+    static final String LOG_W = \"[w]\";\n+    static final String LOG_OK = \"[ok]\";\n+\n+    static void log(String code, String msg) {\n+        System.out.println(code + \" \" + msg);\n+    }\n+\n+    static String streamName(int stream) {\n+        try {\n+            return AudioSystem.STREAM_NAMES[stream];\n+        } catch (ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException e) {\n+            return \"invalid stream\";\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+}"

runInstall() throws RemoteException {\n+        long startedTime = SystemClock.elapsedRealtime();\n         final InstallParams params = makeInstallParams();\n+        final String inPath = nextArg();\n+        if (params.sessionParams.sizeBytes == -1 && !STDIN_PATH.equals(inPath)) {\n+            File file = new File(inPath);\n+            if (file.isFile()) {\n+                try {\n+             "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,106 @@\n+/*\n+ * Copyright (C) 2017 The Android Open Source Project\n+ *\n+ * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the \"License\");\n+ * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.\n+ * You may obtain a copy of the License at\n+ *\n+ *      http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0\n+ *\n+ * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software\n+ * distributed under the License is distributed on an \"AS IS\" BASIS,\n+ * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.\n+ * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and\n+ * limitations under the License.\n+ */\n+\n+package com.android.commands.vr;\n+\n+import android.app.Vr2dDisplayProperties;\n+import android.content.Context;\n+import android.os.RemoteException;\n+import android.os.ServiceManager;\n+\n+import android.service.vr.IVrManager;\n+import com.android.internal.os.BaseCommand;\n+\n+import java.io.PrintStream;\n+\n+public final class Vr extends BaseCommand {\n+\n+    /**\n+     * Command-line entry point.\n+     *\n+     * @param args The command-line arguments\n+     */\n+    public static void main(String[] args) {\n+      (new Vr()).run(args);\n+    }\n+\n+    private static final String COMMAND_SET_PERSISTENT_VR_MODE_ENABLED =\n+        \"set-persistent-vr-mode-enabled\";\n+    private static final String COMMAND_SET_VR2D_DISPLAY_PROPERTIES =\n+        \"set-display-props\";\n+\n+    private IVrManager mVrService;\n+\n+    @Override\n+    public void onShowUsage(PrintStream out) {\n+        out.println(\n+                \"usage: vr [subcommand]\\n\" +\n+                \"usage: vr set-persistent-vr-mode-enabled [true|false]\\n\" +\n+                \"usage: vr set-display-props [width] [height] [dpi]\\n\"\n+                );\n+    }\n+\n+    @Override\n+    public void onRun() throws Exception {\n+        mVrService = IVrManager.Stub.asInterface(ServiceManager.getService(Context.VR_SERVICE));\n+        if (mVrService == null) {\n+            showError(\"Error: Could not access the Vr Manager. Is the system running?\");\n+            return;\n+        }\n+\n+        String command = nextArgRequired();\n+        switch (command) {\n+            case COMMAND_SET_VR2D_DISPLAY_PROPERTIES:\n+                runSetVr2dDisplayProperties();\n+                break;\n+            case COMMAND_SET_PERSISTENT_VR_MODE_ENABLED:\n+                runSetPersistentVrModeEnabled();\n+                break;\n+            default:\n+                throw new IllegalArgumentException (\"unknown command '\" + command + \"'\");\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+    private void runSetVr2dDisplayProperties() throws RemoteException {\n+        String widthStr = nextArgRequired();\n+        int width = Integer.parseInt(widthStr);\n+\n+        String heightStr = nextArgRequired();\n+        int height = Integer.parseInt(heightStr);\n+\n+        String dpiStr = nextArgRequired();\n+        int dpi = Integer.parseInt(dpiStr);\n+\n+        Vr2dDisplayProperties vr2dDisplayProperties =\n+                new Vr2dDisplayProperties(width, height, dpi);\n+\n+        try {\n+            mVrService.setVr2dDisplayProperties(vr2dDisplayProperties);\n+        } catch (RemoteException re) {\n+            System.err.println(\"Error: Can't set persistent mode \" + re);\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+    private void runSetPersistentVrModeEnabled() throws RemoteException {\n+        String enableStr = nextArg();\n+        boolean enabled = Boolean.parseBoolean(enableStr);\n+        try {\n+            mVrService.setPersistentVrModeEnabled(enabled);\n+        } catch (RemoteException re) {\n+            System.err.println(\"Error: Can't set persistent mode \" + re);\n+        }\n+    }\n+}"

       AndroidRuntime::onExit(code);\n+    }\n+};\n+\n+}  // namespace android\n+\n+int main(int argc, char* const argv[]) {\n+    if (prctl(PR_SET_NO_NEW_PRIVS, 1, 0, 0, 0) < 0) {\n+        LOG_ALWAYS_FATAL(\"PR_SET_NO_NEW_PRIVS failed: %s\", strerror(errno));\n+        return 12;\n+    }\n+\n+    size_t argBlockSize = 0;\n+    for (int i = 0; i < argc; ++i) {\n+        argBlockSize += strlen(argv[i]) + 1;\n+    }\n+\n+    android::WebViewRuntime runtime(argv[0], argBlockSize);\n+    runtime.addOption(\"-Xzygote\");\n+\n+    android::Vector<android::String8> args;\n+             "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,218 @@\n+/*\n+ * Copyright (C) 2017 The Android Open Source Project\n+ *\n+ * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the \"License\");\n+ * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.\n+ * You may obtain a copy of the License at\n+ *\n+ *      http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0\n+ *\n+ * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software\n+ * distributed under the License is distributed on an \"AS IS\" BASIS,\n+ * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.\n+ * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and\n+ * limitations under the License.\n+ */\n+\n+package android.accessibilityservice;\n+\n+import android.annotation.NonNull;\n+import android.annotation.Nullable;\n+import android.os.Handler;\n+import android.os.Looper;\n+import android.os.RemoteException;\n+import android.util.ArrayMap;\n+import android.util.Slog;\n+\n+import com.android.internal.util.Preconditions;\n+\n+/**\n+ * Controller for the accessibility button within the system's navigation area\n+ * <p>\n+ * This class may be used to query the accessibility button's state and register\n+ * callbacks for interactions with and state changes to the accessibility button when\n+ * {@link AccessibilityServiceInfo#FLAG_REQUEST_ACCESSIBILITY_BUTTON} is set.\n+ * </p>\n+ * <p>\n+ * <strong>Note:</strong> This class and\n+ * {@link AccessibilityServiceInfo#FLAG_REQUEST_ACCESSIBILITY_BUTTON} should not be used as\n+ * the sole means for offering functionality to users via an {@link AccessibilityService}.\n+ * Some device implementations may choose not to provide a software-rendered system\n+ * navigation area, making this affordance permanently unavailable.\n+ * </p>\n+ * <p>\n+ * <strong>Note:</strong> On device implementations where the accessibility button is\n+ * supported, it may not be available at all times, such as when a foreground application uses\n+ * {@link android.view.View#SYSTEM_UI_FLAG_HIDE_NAVIGATION}. A user may also choose to assign\n+ * this button to another accessibility service or feature. In each of these cases, a\n+ * registered {@link AccessibilityButtonCallback}'s\n+ * {@link AccessibilityButtonCallback#onAvailabilityChanged(AccessibilityButtonController, boolean)}\n+ * method will be invoked to provide notifications of changes in the accessibility button's\n+ * availability to the registering service.\n+ * </p>\n+ */\n+public final class AccessibilityButtonController {\n+    private static final String LOG_TAG = \"A11yButtonController\";\n+\n+    private final IAccessibilityServiceConnection mServiceConnection;\n+    private final Object mLock;\n+    private ArrayMap<AccessibilityButtonCallback, Handler> mCallbacks;\n+\n+    AccessibilityButtonController(@NonNull IAccessibilityServiceConnection serviceConnection) {\n+        mServiceConnection = serviceConnection;\n+        mLock = new Object();\n+    }\n+\n+    /**\n+     * Retrieves whether the accessibility button in the system's navigation area is\n+     * available to the calling service.\n+     * <p>\n+     * <strong>Note:</strong> If the service is not yet connected (e.g.\n+     * {@link AccessibilityService#onServiceConnected()} has not yet been called) or the\n+     * service has been disconnected, this method will have no effect and return {@code false}.\n+     * </p>\n+     *\n+     * @return {@code true} if the accessibility button in the system's navigation area is\n+     * available to the calling service, {@code false} otherwise\n+     */\n+    public boolean isAccessibilityButtonAvailable() {\n+        try {\n+            return mServiceConnection.isAccessibilityButtonAvailable();\n+        } catch (RemoteException re) {\n+            Slog.w(LOG_TAG, \"Failed to get accessibility button availability.\", re);\n+            re.rethrowFromSystemServer();\n+            return false;\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+    /**\n+     * Registers the provided {@link AccessibilityButtonCallback} for interaction and state\n+     * changes callbacks related to the accessibility button.\n+     *\n+     * @param callback the callback to add, must be non-null\n+     */\n+    public void registerAccessibilityButtonCallback(@NonNull AccessibilityButtonCallback callback) {\n+        registerAccessibilityButtonCallback(callback, new Handler(Looper.getMainLooper()));\n+    }\n+\n+    /**\n+     * Registers the provided {@link AccessibilityButtonCallback} for interaction and state\n+     * change callbacks related to the accessibility button. The callback will occur on the\n+     * specified {@link Handler}'s thread, or on the services's main thread if the handler is\n+     * {@code null}.\n+     *\n+     * @param callback the callback to add, must be non-null\n+     * @param handler the handler on which the callback should execute, must be non-null\n+     */\n+    public void registerAccessibilityButtonCallback(@NonNull AccessibilityButtonCallback callback,\n+            @NonNull Handler handler) {\n+        Preconditions.checkNotNull(callback);\n+        Preconditions.checkNotNull(handler);\n+        synchronized (mLock) {\n+            if (mCallbacks == null) {\n+                mCallbacks = new ArrayMap<>();\n+            }\n+\n+            mCallbacks.put(callback, handler);\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+    /**\n+     * Unregisters the provided {@link AccessibilityButtonCallback} for interaction and state\n+     * change callbacks related to the accessibility button.\n+     *\n+     * @param callback the callback to remove, must be non-null\n+     */\n+    public void unregisterAccessibilityButtonCallback(\n+            @NonNull AccessibilityButtonCallback callback) {\n+        Preconditions.checkNotNull(callback);\n+        synchronized (mLock) {\n+            if (mCallbacks == null) {\n+                return;\n+            }\n+\n+            final int keyIndex = mCallbacks.indexOfKey(callback);\n+            final boolean hasKey = keyIndex >= 0;\n+            if (hasKey) {\n+                mCallbacks.removeAt(keyIndex);\n+            }\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+    /**\n+     * Dispatches the accessibility button click to any registered callbacks. This should\n+     * be called on the service's main thread.\n+     */\n+    void dispatchAccessibilityButtonClicked() {\n+        final ArrayMap<AccessibilityButtonCallback, Handler> entries;\n+        synchronized (mLock) {\n+            if (mCallbacks == null || mCallbacks.isEmpty()) {\n+                Slog.w(LOG_TAG, \"Received accessibility button click with no callbacks!\");\n+                return;\n+            }\n+\n+            // Callbacks may remove themselves. Perform a shallow copy to avoid concurrent\n+            // modification.\n+            entries = new ArrayMap<>(mCallbacks);\n+        }\n+\n+        for (int i = 0, count = entries.size(); i < count; i++) {\n+            final AccessibilityButtonCallback callback = entries.keyAt(i);\n+            final Handler handler = entries.valueAt(i);\n+            handler.post(() -> callback.onClicked(this));\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+    /**\n+     * Dispatches the accessibility button availability changes to any registered callbacks.\n+     * This should be called on the service's main thread.\n+     */\n+    void dispatchAccessibilityButtonAvailabilityChanged(boolean available) {\n+        final ArrayMap<AccessibilityButtonCallback, Handler> entries;\n+        synchronized (mLock) {\n+            if (mCallbacks == null || mCallbacks.isEmpty()) {\n+                Slog.w(LOG_TAG,\n+                        \"Received accessibility button availability change with no callbacks!\");\n+                return;\n+            }\n+\n+            // Callbacks may remove themselves. Perform a shallow copy to avoid concurrent\n+            // modification.\n+            entries = new ArrayMap<>(mCallbacks);\n+        }\n+\n+        for (int i = 0, count = entries.size(); i < count; i++) {\n+            final AccessibilityButtonCallback callback = entries.keyAt(i);\n+            final Handler handler = entries.valueAt(i);\n+            handler.post(() -> callback.onAvailabilityChanged(this, available));\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+    /**\n+     * Callback for interaction with and changes to state of the accessibility button\n+     * within the system's navigation area.\n+     */\n+    public static abstract class AccessibilityButtonCallback {\n+\n+        /**\n+         * Called when the accessibility button in the system's navigation area is clicked.\n+         *\n+         * @param controller the controller used to register for this callback\n+         */\n+        public void onClicked(AccessibilityButtonController controller) {}\n+\n+        /**\n+         * Called when the availability of the accessibility button in the system's\n+         * navigation area has changed. The accessibility button may become unavailable\n+         * because the device shopped showing the button, the button was assigned to another\n+         * service, or for other reasons.\n+         *\n+         * @param controller the controller used to register for this callback\n+         * @param available {@code true} if the accessibility button is available to this\n+         *                  service, {@code false} otherwise\n+         */\n+        public void onAvailabilityChanged(AccessibilityButtonController controller,\n+                boolean available) {\n+        }\n+    }\n+}"
        },

            "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,185 @@\n+/*\n+ * Copyright (C) 2017 The Android Open Source Project\n+ *\n+ * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the \"License\");\n+ * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.\n+ * You may obtain a copy of the License at\n+ *\n+ *      http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0\n+ *\n+ * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software\n+ * distributed under the License is distributed on an \"AS IS\" BASIS,\n+ * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.\n+ * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and\n+ * limitations under the License.\n+ */\n+\n+package android.accessibilityservice;\n+\n+import android.annotation.NonNull;\n+import android.annotation.Nullable;\n+import android.os.Handler;\n+import android.os.RemoteException;\n+import android.util.ArrayMap;\n+import android.util.Log;\n+import com.android.internal.annotations.VisibleForTesting;\n+\n+/**\n+ * An {@link AccessibilityService} can capture gestures performed on a device's fingerprint\n+ * sensor, as long as the device has a sensor capable of detecting gestures.\n+ * <p>\n+ * This capability must be declared by the service as\n+ * {@link AccessibilityServiceInfo#CAPABILITY_CAN_CAPTURE_FINGERPRINT_GESTURES}. It also requires\n+ * the permission {@link android.Manifest.permission#USE_FINGERPRINT}.\n+ * <p>\n+ * Because capturing fingerprint gestures may have side effects, services with the capability only\n+ * capture gestures when {@link AccessibilityServiceInfo#FLAG_CAPTURE_FINGERPRINT_GESTURES} is set.\n+ * <p>\n+ * <strong>Note: </strong>The fingerprint sensor is used for authentication in critical use cases,\n+ * so services must carefully design their user's experience when performing gestures on the sensor.\n+ * When the sensor is in use by an app, for example, when authenticating or enrolling a user,\n+ * the sensor will not detect gestures. Services need to ensure that users understand when the\n+ * sensor is in-use for authentication to prevent users from authenticating unintentionally when\n+ * trying to interact with the service. They can use\n+ * {@link FingerprintGestureCallback#onGestureDetectionAvailabilityChanged(boolean)} to learn when\n+ * gesture detection becomes unavailable.\n+ * <p>\n+ * Multiple accessibility services may listen for fingerprint gestures simultaneously, so services\n+ * should provide a way for the user to disable the use of this feature so multiple services don't\n+ * conflict with each other.\n+ * <p>\n+ * {@see android.hardware.fingerprint.FingerprintManager#isHardwareDetected}\n+ */\n+public final class FingerprintGestureController {\n+    /** Identifier for a swipe right on the fingerprint sensor */\n+    public static final int FINGERPRINT_GESTURE_SWIPE_RIGHT = 0x00000001;\n+\n+    /** Identifier for a swipe left on the fingerprint sensor */\n+    public static final int FINGERPRINT_GESTURE_SWIPE_LEFT = 0x00000002;\n+\n+    /** Identifier for a swipe up on the fingerprint sensor */\n+    public static final int FINGERPRINT_GESTURE_SWIPE_UP = 0x00000004;\n+\n+    /** Identifier for a swipe down on the fingerprint sensor */\n+    public static final int FINGERPRINT_GESTURE_SWIPE_DOWN = 0x00000008;\n+\n+    private static final String LOG_TAG = \"FingerprintGestureController\";\n+    private final Object mLock = new Object();\n+    private final IAccessibilityServiceConnection mAccessibilityServiceConnection;\n+\n+    private final ArrayMap<FingerprintGestureCallback, Handler> mCallbackHandlerMap =\n+            new ArrayMap<>(1);\n+\n+    /**\n+     * @param connection The connection to use for system interactions\n+     * @hide\n+     */\n+    @VisibleForTesting\n+    public FingerprintGestureController(IAccessibilityServiceConnection connection) {\n+        mAccessibilityServiceConnection = connection;\n+    }\n+\n+    /**\n+     * Gets if the fingerprint sensor's gesture detection is available.\n+     *\n+     * @return {@code true} if the sensor's gesture detection is available. {@code false} if it is\n+     * not currently detecting gestures (for example, if it is enrolling a finger).\n+     */\n+    public boolean isGestureDetectionAvailable() {\n+        try {\n+            return mAccessibilityServiceConnection.isFingerprintGestureDetectionAvailable();\n+        } catch (RemoteException re) {\n+            Log.w(LOG_TAG, \"Failed to check if fingerprint gestures are active\", re);\n+            re.rethrowFromSystemServer();\n+            return false;\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+    /**\n+     * Register a callback to be informed of fingerprint sensor gesture events.\n+     *\n+     * @param callback The listener to be added.\n+     * @param handler The handler to use for the callback. If {@code null}, callbacks will happen\n+     * on the service's main thread.\n+     */\n+    public void registerFingerprintGestureCallback(\n+            @NonNull FingerprintGestureCallback callback, @Nullable Handler handler) {\n+        synchronized (mLock) {\n+            mCallbackHandlerMap.put(callback, handler);\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+    /**\n+     * Unregister a listener added with {@link #registerFingerprintGestureCallback}.\n+     *\n+     * @param callback The callback to remove. Removing a callback that was never added has no\n+     * effect.\n+     */\n+    public void unregisterFingerprintGestureCallback(FingerprintGestureCallback callback) {\n+        synchronized (mLock) {\n+            mCallbackHandlerMap.remove(callback);\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+    /**\n+     * Called when gesture detection becomes active or inactive\n+     * @hide\n+     */\n+    public void onGestureDetectionActiveChanged(boolean active) {\n+        final ArrayMap<FingerprintGestureCallback, Handler> handlerMap;\n+        synchronized (mLock) {\n+            handlerMap = new ArrayMap<>(mCallbackHandlerMap);\n+        }\n+        int numListeners = handlerMap.size();\n+        for (int i = 0; i < numListeners; i++) {\n+            FingerprintGestureCallback callback = handlerMap.keyAt(i);\n+            Handler handler = handlerMap.valueAt(i);\n+            if (handler != null) {\n+                handler.post(() -> callback.onGestureDetectionAvailabilityChanged(active));\n+            } else {\n+                callback.onGestureDetectionAvailabilityChanged(active);\n+            }\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+    /**\n+     * Called when gesture is detected.\n+     * @hide\n+     */\n+    public void onGesture(int gesture) {\n+        final ArrayMap<FingerprintGestureCallback, Handler> handlerMap;\n+        synchronized (mLock) {\n+            handlerMap = new ArrayMap<>(mCallbackHandlerMap);\n+        }\n+        int numListeners = handlerMap.size();\n+        for (int i = 0; i < numListeners; i++) {\n+            FingerprintGestureCallback callback = handlerMap.keyAt(i);\n+            Handler handler = handlerMap.valueAt(i);\n+            if (handler != null) {\n+                handler.post(() -> callback.onGestureDetected(gesture));\n+            } else {\n+                callback.onGestureDetected(gesture);\n+            }\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+    /**\n+     * Class that is called back when fingerprint gestures are being used for accessibility.\n+     */\n+    public abstract static class FingerprintGestureCallback {\n+        /**\n+         * Called when the fingerprint sensor's gesture detection becomes available or unavailable.\n+         *\n+         * @param available Whether or not the sensor's gesture detection is now available.\n+         */\n+        public void onGestureDetectionAvailabilityChanged(boolean available) {}\n+\n+        /**\n+         * Called when the fingerprint sensor detects gestures.\n+         *\n+         * @param gesture The id of the gesture that was detected. For example,\n+         * {@link #FINGERPRINT_GESTURE_SWIPE_RIGHT}.\n+         */\n+        public void onGestureDetected(int gesture) {}\n+    }\n+}"

Additionally it specifies Account visibility\n+     * for given list of packages.\n+     * <p>\n+     * Normally used by sign-up wizards associated with authenticators, not directly by\n+     * applications.\n+     * <p>\n+     * Calling this method does not update the last authenticated timestamp, referred by\n+     * {@link #KEY_LAST_AUTHENTICATED_TIME}. To update it, call\n+     * {@link #notifyAccountAuthenticated(Account)} after getting success.\n+     * <p>\n+     * It is safe to call this method from the main thread.\n+     * <p>\n+     * This method requires the caller to have a signature match with the authenticator that owns\n+     * the specified account.\n+     *\n+     * @param account The {@link Account} to add\n+     * @param password The password to associate with the account, null for none\n+     * @param extras String values to use for the account's userdata, null for none\n+     * @param visibility Map from packageName to visibility values which will be set before account\n+     *        is added.
